00075 //Kris:  December 2, 1997
00076 //Special internal debugging utilities that will ensure that you don't attempt to delete
00077 //an already deleted button, or it's images, etc.  It will also ensure that you don't create
00078 //the same button that already exists.
00079 //TO REMOVE ALL DEBUG FUNCTIONALITY:  simply comment out BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING definition
00080 #ifdef JA2
00081   #ifdef _DEBUG
00082         #define BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
00083   #endif
00084 #endif
00085 
00086 #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
00087 BOOLEAN gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions; // symbol already declared globally in mousesystem.cpp (jonathanl)
00088 //Called immediately before assigning the button to the button list.
00089 void AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( GUI_BUTTON *b )
00090 {
00091       INT32 x;
00092       GUI_BUTTON *c;
00093       for( x = 0; x < MAX_BUTTONS; x++ )
00094       {
00095             c = ButtonList[ x ];
00096             if( !c )                                                                                                                                                                            continue;
00097             if( c->uiFlags                                                    &  BUTTON_DELETION_PENDING          )   continue;
00098             if( c->UserData[3]                                          == 0xffffffff                                                     )           continue;
00099             if( b->Area.PriorityLevel                       != c->Area.PriorityLevel                  )           continue;
00100             if( b->Area.RegionTopLeftX                != c->Area.RegionTopLeftX                 )           continue;
00101             if( b->Area.RegionTopLeftY                != c->Area.RegionTopLeftY                 )           continue;
00102             if( b->Area.RegionBottomRightX      != c->Area.RegionBottomRightX )           continue;
00103             if( b->Area.RegionBottomRightY      != c->Area.RegionBottomRightY )           continue;
00104             if( b->ClickCallback                                  != c->ClickCallback                                   )           continue;
00105             if( b->MoveCallback                                         != c->MoveCallback                                    )           continue;
00106             if( b->XLoc                                                             != c->XLoc                                                        )           continue;
00107             if( b->YLoc                                                             != c->YLoc                                                        )           continue;
00108             //if we get this far, it is reasonably safe to assume that the newly created
00109             //button already exists.  Placing a break point on the following assert will
00110             //allow the coder to easily isolate the case!
00111             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to create a button that has already been created (existing buttonID %d).", c->IDNum );
00112             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00113       }
00114 }
00115 #endif

00118 //These are the variables used for the anchoring of a particular button.
00119 //When you click on a button, it get's anchored, until you release the mouse button.

00176 //=============================================================================
00177 //    FindFreeButtonSlot
00178 //
00179 //    Finds an available slot for loading button pictures
00180 //
00181 INT32 FindFreeButtonSlot(void)
00182 {
00183       int slot;
00184 
00185       // Are there any slots available?
00186       if(ButtonPicsLoaded >= MAX_BUTTON_PICS)
00187             return(BUTTON_NO_SLOT);
00188 
00189       // Search for a slot
00190       for(slot=0;slot<MAX_BUTTON_PICS;slot++)
00191       {
00192             if(ButtonPictures[slot].vobj==NULL)
00193                   return(slot);
00194       }
00195 
00196       return(BUTTON_NO_SLOT);
00197 }

00201 //=============================================================================
00202 //    LoadButtonImage
00203 //
00204 //    Load images for use with QuickButtons.
00205 //
00206 template INT32 LoadButtonImage<unsigned char *>(unsigned char *, INT32, INT32, INT32, INT32, INT32);
00207 template INT32 LoadButtonImage<char *>(char *, INT32, INT32, INT32, INT32, INT32);
00208 template <typename type1>
00209 INT32 LoadButtonImage(type1 filename, INT32 Grayed, INT32 OffNormal, INT32 OffHilite, INT32 OnNormal, INT32 OnHilite)
00210 {
00211       VOBJECT_DESC      vo_desc;
00212       UINT32                        UseSlot;
00213       ETRLEObject       *pTrav;
00214       UINT32                        MaxHeight,MaxWidth,ThisHeight,ThisWidth;
00215       UINT32 MemBefore,MemAfter,MemUsed;
00216 
00217       AssertMsg(filename!=BUTTON_NO_FILENAME, "Attempting to LoadButtonImage() with null filename." );
00218       AssertMsg(strlen(filename), "Attempting to LoadButtonImage() with empty filename string." );
00219 
00220       // is there ANY file to open?
00221       if((Grayed == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) &&
00222              (OnNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OnHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE))
00223       {
00224             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("No button pictures selected for %s",filename));
00225             return(-1);
00226       }
00227 
00228       // Get a button image slot
00229       if((UseSlot=FindFreeButtonSlot()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
00230       {
00231             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Out of button image slots for %s",filename));
00232             return(-1);
00233       }
00234 
00235       // Load the image
00236       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00237       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, filename);
00238 
00239       MemBefore = MemGetFree();
00240       if((ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
00241       {
00242             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",filename));
00243             return(-1);
00244       }
00245       MemAfter = MemGetFree();
00246       MemUsed = MemBefore-MemAfter;
00247 
00248       // Init the QuickButton image structure with indexes to use
00249       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].Grayed=Grayed;
00250       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffNormal=OffNormal;
00251       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffHilite=OffHilite;
00252       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnNormal=OnNormal;
00253       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnHilite=OnHilite;
00254       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].fFlags = GUI_BTN_NONE;
00255 
00256       // Fit the button size to the largest image in the set
00257       MaxWidth=MaxHeight=0;
00258       if(Grayed != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00259       {
00260             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[Grayed]);
00261             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00262             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00263 
00264             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00265                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00266             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00267                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00268       }
00269 
00270       if(OffNormal != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00271       {
00272             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OffNormal]);
00273             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00274             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00275 
00276             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00277                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00278             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00279                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00280       }
00281 
00282       if(OffHilite != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00283       {
00284             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OffHilite]);
00285             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00286             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00287 
00288             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00289                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00290             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00291                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00292       }
00293 
00294       if(OnNormal != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00295       {
00296             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OnNormal]);
00297             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00298             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00299 
00300             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00301                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00302             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00303                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00304       }
00305 
00306       if(OnHilite != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00307       {
00308             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OnHilite]);
00309             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00310             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00311 
00312             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00313                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00314             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00315                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00316       }
00317 
00318       // Set the width and height for this image set
00319       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxHeight=MaxHeight;
00320       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxWidth=MaxWidth;
00321 
00322       // return the image slot number
00323       ButtonPicsLoaded++;
00324       return(UseSlot);
00325 }

00328 //=============================================================================
00329 //    UseLoadedButtonImage
00330 //
00331 //    Uses a previously loaded quick button image for use with QuickButtons.
00332 //    The function simply duplicates the vobj!
00333 //
00334 INT32 UseLoadedButtonImage(INT32 LoadedImg, INT32 Grayed, INT32 OffNormal, INT32 OffHilite, INT32 OnNormal, INT32 OnHilite)
00335 {
00336       UINT32                        UseSlot;
00337       ETRLEObject       *pTrav;
00338       UINT32                        MaxHeight,MaxWidth,ThisHeight,ThisWidth;
00339 
00340 
00341       // Is button image index given valid?
00342       if( ButtonPictures[LoadedImg].vobj == NULL )
00343       {
00344             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Invalid button picture handle given for pre-loaded button image %d",LoadedImg));
00345             return(-1);
00346       }
00347 
00348       // Is button image an external vobject?
00349       if( ButtonPictures[LoadedImg].fFlags & GUI_BTN_EXTERNAL_VOBJ )
00350       {
00351             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Invalid button picture handle given (%d), cannot use external images as duplicates.",LoadedImg));
00352             return(-1);
00353       }
00354 
00355       // is there ANY file to open?
00356       if((Grayed == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) &&
00357              (OnNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OnHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE))
00358       {
00359             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("No button pictures selected for pre-loaded button image %d",LoadedImg));
00360             return(-1);
00361       }
00362 
00363       // Get a button image slot
00364       if((UseSlot=FindFreeButtonSlot()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
00365       {
00366             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Out of button image slots for pre-loaded button image %d",LoadedImg));
00367             return(-1);
00368       }
00369 
00370       // Init the QuickButton image structure with indexes to use
00371       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj = ButtonPictures[LoadedImg].vobj;
00372       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].Grayed=Grayed;
00373       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffNormal=OffNormal;
00374       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffHilite=OffHilite;
00375       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnNormal=OnNormal;
00376       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnHilite=OnHilite;
00377       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].fFlags = GUI_BTN_DUPLICATE_VOBJ;
00378 
00379       // Fit the button size to the largest image in the set
00380       MaxWidth=MaxHeight=0;
00381       if(Grayed != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00382       {
00383             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[Grayed]);
00384             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00385             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00386 
00387             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00388                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00389             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00390                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00391       }
00392 
00393       if(OffNormal != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00394       {
00395             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OffNormal]);
00396             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00397             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00398 
00399             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00400                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00401             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00402                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00403       }
00404 
00405       if(OffHilite != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00406       {
00407             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OffHilite]);
00408             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00409             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00410 
00411             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00412                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00413             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00414                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00415       }
00416 
00417       if(OnNormal != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00418       {
00419             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OnNormal]);
00420             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00421             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00422 
00423             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00424                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00425             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00426                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00427       }
00428 
00429       if(OnHilite != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00430       {
00431             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[OnHilite]);
00432             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00433             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00434 
00435             if(MaxWidth<ThisWidth)
00436                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00437             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00438                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;
00439       }
00440 
00441       // Set the width and height for this image set
00442       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxHeight=MaxHeight;
00443       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxWidth=MaxWidth;
00444 
00445       // return the image slot number
00446       ButtonPicsLoaded++;
00447       return(UseSlot);
00448 }

00452 //=============================================================================
00453 //    UseVObjAsButtonImage
00454 //
00455 //    Uses a previously loaded VObject for use with QuickButtons.
00456 //    The function simply duplicates the vobj pointer and uses that.
00457 //
00458 //          **** NOTE ****
00459 //                The image isn't unloaded with a call to UnloadButtonImage. The internal
00460 //                structures are simply removed from the button image list. It's up to
00461 //                the user to actually unload the image.
00462 //
00463 INT32 UseVObjAsButtonImage(HVOBJECT hVObject, INT32 Grayed, INT32 OffNormal, INT32 OffHilite, INT32 OnNormal, INT32 OnHilite)
00464 {
00465       UINT32                        UseSlot;
00466       ETRLEObject       *pTrav;
00467       UINT32                        MaxHeight,MaxWidth,ThisHeight,ThisWidth;
00468 
00469 
00470       // Is button image index given valid?
00471       if( hVObject == NULL )
00472       {
00473             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("UseVObjAsButtonImage: Invalid VObject image given"));
00474             return(-1);
00475       }
00476 
00477       // is there ANY file to open?
00478       if((Grayed == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OffHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) &&
00479              (OnNormal == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE) && (OnHilite == BUTTON_NO_IMAGE))
00480       {
00481             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("UseVObjAsButtonImage: No button pictures indexes selected for VObject"));
00482             return(-1);
00483       }
00484 
00485       // Get a button image slot
00486       if((UseSlot=FindFreeButtonSlot()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
00487       {
00488             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("UseVObjAsButtonImage: Out of button image slots for VObject"));
00489             return(-1);
00490       }
00491 
00492       // Init the QuickButton image structure with indexes to use
00493       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj = hVObject;
00494       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].Grayed=Grayed;
00495       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffNormal=OffNormal;
00496       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OffHilite=OffHilite;
00497       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnNormal=OnNormal;
00498       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].OnHilite=OnHilite;
00499       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].fFlags = GUI_BTN_EXTERNAL_VOBJ;
00500 
00501       // Fit the button size to the largest image in the set
00502       MaxWidth=MaxHeight=0;
00503       if(Grayed != BUTTON_NO_IMAGE)
00504       {
00505             pTrav = &(ButtonPictures[UseSlot].vobj->pETRLEObject[Grayed]);
00506             ThisHeight = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
00507             ThisWidth = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
00508

00510                   MaxWidth=ThisWidth;
00511             if(MaxHeight<ThisHeight)
00512                   MaxHeight=ThisHeight;

00564       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxHeight=MaxHeight;
00565       ButtonPictures[UseSlot].MaxWidth=MaxWidth;
00566 
00567       // return the image slot number
00568       ButtonPicsLoaded++;
00569       return(UseSlot);
00570 }
00571 
00572 
00573 
00574 //=============================================================================
00575 //    SetButtonDestBuffer
00576 //
00577 //    Sets the destination buffer for all button blits.
00578 //
00579 BOOLEAN SetButtonDestBuffer(UINT32 DestBuffer)
00580 {
00581       if(DestBuffer != BUTTON_USE_DEFAULT)
00582             ButtonDestBuffer = DestBuffer;
00583 
00584       return(TRUE);
00585 }
00586 
00587 
00588 
00589 //Removes a QuickButton image from the system.
00590 void UnloadButtonImage(INT32 Index)
00591 {
00592       INT32 x;
00593       BOOLEAN fDone;
00594 
00595       if( Index < 0 || Index >= MAX_BUTTON_PICS )
00596       {
00597             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to UnloadButtonImage with out of range index %d.", Index );
00598             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00599       }
00600 
00601       if( !ButtonPictures[ Index ].vobj )
00602       {
00603             #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
00604             if( gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions )
00605             #endif
00606                   return;
00607             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to UnloadButtonImage that has a null vobj (already deleted).");
00608       }
00609 
00610       // If this is a duplicated button image, then don't trash the vobject
00611       if(ButtonPictures[Index].fFlags & GUI_BTN_DUPLICATE_VOBJ || ButtonPictures[Index].fFlags & GUI_BTN_EXTERNAL_VOBJ)
00612       {
00613             ButtonPictures[Index].vobj = NULL;
00614             ButtonPicsLoaded--;
00615       }
00616       else
00617       {
00618             // Deleting a non-duplicate, so see if any dups present. if so, then
00619             // convert one of them to an original!
00620 
00621             fDone = FALSE;
00622             for( x = 0; x < MAX_BUTTON_PICS && !fDone; x++ )
00623             {
00624                   if( (x != Index) && (ButtonPictures[x].vobj == ButtonPictures[Index].vobj) )
00625                   {
00626                         if ( ButtonPictures[x].fFlags & GUI_BTN_DUPLICATE_VOBJ )
00627                         {
00628                               // If we got here, then we got a duplicate object of the one we
00629                               // want to delete, so convert it to an original!
00630                               ButtonPictures[x].fFlags &= (~GUI_BTN_DUPLICATE_VOBJ);
00631 
00632                               // Now remove this button, but not it's vobject
00633                               ButtonPictures[Index].vobj = NULL;
00634 
00635                               fDone = TRUE;
00636                               ButtonPicsLoaded--;
00637                         }
00638                   }
00639             }
00640       }
00641 
00642       // If image slot isn't empty, delete the image
00643       if(ButtonPictures[Index].vobj != NULL)
00644       {
00645             DeleteVideoObject(ButtonPictures[Index].vobj);
00646             ButtonPictures[Index].vobj = NULL;
00647             ButtonPicsLoaded--;
00648       }
00649 }
00650 
00651 
00652 
00653 //=============================================================================
00654 //    EnableButton
00655 //
00656 //    Enables an already created button.
00657 //
00658 BOOLEAN EnableButton( INT32 iButtonID )
00659 {
00660       GUI_BUTTON *b;
00661       UINT32 OldState;
00662 
00663       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
00664       {
00665             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to EnableButton with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
00666             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00667       }
00668 
00669       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
00670 
00671       // If button exists, set the ENABLED flag
00672       if( b )
00673       {
00674             OldState = b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED;
00675             b->uiFlags |= ( BUTTON_ENABLED | BUTTON_DIRTY );
00676       }
00677       else
00678             OldState = 0;
00679 
00680 
00681       // Return previous ENABLED state of this button
00682       return((OldState==BUTTON_ENABLED)?TRUE:FALSE);
00683 }
00684 
00685 
00686 
00687 //=============================================================================
00688 //    DisableButton
00689 //
00690 //    Disables a button. The button remains in the system list, and can be
00691 //    reactivated by calling EnableButton.
00692 //
00693 //    Diabled buttons will appear "grayed out" on the screen (unless the
00694 //    graphics for such are not available).
00695 //
00696 BOOLEAN DisableButton(INT32 iButtonID )
00697 {
00698       GUI_BUTTON *b;
00699       UINT32 OldState;
00700 
00701       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
00702       {
00703             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to DisableButton with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
00704             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00705       }
00706 
00707       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
00708 
00709       // If button exists, reset the ENABLED flag
00710       if( b )
00711       {
00712             OldState = b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED;
00713             b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_ENABLED);
00714             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
00715       }
00716       else
00717             OldState = 0;
00718 
00719       // Return previous ENABLED state of button
00720       return((OldState==BUTTON_ENABLED)?TRUE:FALSE);
00721 }
00722 
00723 
00724 
00725 //=============================================================================
00726 //    InitializeButtonImageManager
00727 //
00728 //    Initializes the button image sub-system. This function is called by
00729 //    InitButtonSystem.
00730 //
00731 BOOLEAN InitializeButtonImageManager(INT32 DefaultBuffer, INT32 DefaultPitch, INT32 DefaultBPP)
00732 {
00733       VOBJECT_DESC      vo_desc;
00734       UINT8 Pix;
00735       int x;
00736 
00737       // Set up the default settings
00738       if(DefaultBuffer != BUTTON_USE_DEFAULT)
00739             ButtonDestBuffer = (UINT32)DefaultBuffer;
00740       else
00741             ButtonDestBuffer = FRAME_BUFFER;
00742 
00743       if(DefaultPitch != BUTTON_USE_DEFAULT)
00744             ButtonDestPitch = (UINT32)DefaultPitch;
00745       else
00746             ButtonDestPitch = 640*2;
00747 
00748       if(DefaultBPP != BUTTON_USE_DEFAULT)
00749             ButtonDestBPP = (UINT32)DefaultBPP;
00750       else
00751             ButtonDestBPP = 16;
00752 
00753       // Blank out all QuickButton images
00754       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTON_PICS;x++)
00755       {
00756             ButtonPictures[x].vobj=NULL;
00757             ButtonPictures[x].Grayed = -1;
00758             ButtonPictures[x].OffNormal = -1;
00759             ButtonPictures[x].OffHilite = -1;
00760             ButtonPictures[x].OnNormal = -1;
00761             ButtonPictures[x].OnHilite = -1;
00762       }
00763       ButtonPicsLoaded = 0;
00764 
00765       // Blank out all Generic button data
00766       for(x=0;x<MAX_GENERIC_PICS;x++)
00767       {
00768             GenericButtonGrayed[x]=NULL;
00769             GenericButtonOffNormal[x]=NULL;
00770             GenericButtonOffHilite[x]=NULL;
00771             GenericButtonOnNormal[x]=NULL;
00772             GenericButtonOnHilite[x]=NULL;
00773             GenericButtonBackground[x]=NULL;
00774             GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[x]=0;
00775             GenericButtonFillColors[x]=0;
00776             GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[x]=0;
00777             GenericButtonOffsetX[x]=0;
00778             GenericButtonOffsetY[x]=0;
00779       }
00780 
00781       // Blank out all icon images
00782       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTON_ICONS;x++)
00783             GenericButtonIcons[x]=NULL;
00784 
00785       // Load the default generic button images
00786       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00787       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_OFF);
00788 
00789       if((GenericButtonOffNormal[0] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
00790       {
00791             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Couldn't create VOBJECT for "DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_OFF);
00792             return(FALSE);
00793       }
00794 
00795       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00796       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_ON);
00797 
00798       if((GenericButtonOnNormal[0] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
00799       {
00800             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Couldn't create VOBJECT for "DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_ON);
00801             return(FALSE);
00802       }
00803 
00804       // Load up the off hilite and on hilite images. We won't check for errors because if the file
00805       // doesn't exists, the system simply ignores that file. These are only here as extra images, they
00806       // aren't required for operation (only OFF Normal and ON Normal are required).
00807       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00808       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_OFF_HI);
00809       GenericButtonOffHilite[0] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc);
00810 
00811       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00812       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, DEFAULT_GENERIC_BUTTON_ON_HI);
00813       GenericButtonOnHilite[0] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc);
00814 
00815       Pix=0;
00816       if(!GetETRLEPixelValue(&Pix,GenericButtonOffNormal[0],8,0,0))
00817       {
00818             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "Couldn't get generic button's background pixel value");
00819             return(FALSE);
00820       }
00821 
00822       if(GETPIXELDEPTH()==16)
00823             GenericButtonFillColors[0]=GenericButtonOffNormal[0]->p16BPPPalette[Pix];
00824       else if(GETPIXELDEPTH()==8)
00825             GenericButtonFillColors[0]=COLOR_DKGREY;
00826 
00827       return(TRUE);
00828 }
00829 
00830 
00831 
00832 //=============================================================================
00833 //    FindFreeGenericSlot
00834 //
00835 //    Finds the next available slot for generic (TEXT and/or ICONIC) buttons.
00836 //
00837 INT16 FindFreeGenericSlot(void)
00838 {
00839       INT16 slot,x;
00840 
00841       slot=BUTTON_NO_SLOT;
00842       for(x=0;x<MAX_GENERIC_PICS && slot<0;x++)
00843       {
00844             if(GenericButtonOffNormal[x]==NULL)
00845                   slot=x;
00846       }
00847 
00848       return(slot);
00849 }
00850 
00851 
00852 
00853 //=============================================================================
00854 //    FindFreeIconSlot
00855 //
00856 //    Finds the next available slot for button icon images.
00857 //
00858 INT16 FindFreeIconSlot(void)
00859 {
00860       INT16 slot,x;
00861 
00862       slot=BUTTON_NO_SLOT;
00863       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTON_ICONS && slot<0;x++)
00864       {
00865             if(GenericButtonIcons[x]==NULL)
00866                   slot=x;
00867       }
00868 
00869       return(slot);
00870 }

00873 
00874 //=============================================================================
00875 //    LoadGenericButtonIcon
00876 //
00877 //    Loads an image file for use as a button icon.
00878 //
00879 template INT16 LoadGenericButtonIcon<char *>(char *);
00880 template INT16 LoadGenericButtonIcon<char const *>(char const *);
00881 template <typename string1>
00882 INT16 LoadGenericButtonIcon(string1 filename)
00883 {
00884       INT16 ImgSlot;
00885       VOBJECT_DESC      vo_desc;
00886 
00887       AssertMsg(filename != BUTTON_NO_FILENAME, "Attempting to LoadGenericButtonIcon() with null filename.");
00888 
00889       // Get slot for icon image
00890       if((ImgSlot=FindFreeIconSlot()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
00891       {
00892             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "LoadGenericButtonIcon: Out of generic button icon slots");
00893             return(-1);
00894       }
00895 
00896       // Load the icon
00897       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
00898       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, filename);
00899 
00900       if((GenericButtonIcons[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
00901       {
00902             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonIcon: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",filename));
00903             return(-1);
00904       }
00905 
00906       // Return the slot number
00907       return(ImgSlot);
00908 }
00909 
00910 //=============================================================================
00911 //    UnloadGenericButtonIcon
00912 //
00913 //    Removes a button icon graphic from the system
00914 //
00915 BOOLEAN UnloadGenericButtonIcon(INT16 GenImg)
00916 {
00917       if( GenImg < 0 || GenImg >= MAX_BUTTON_ICONS  )
00918       {
00919             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to UnloadGenericButtonIcon with out of range index %d.", GenImg );
00920             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00921       }
00922 
00923       if( !GenericButtonIcons[ GenImg ] )
00924       {
00925             #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
00926             if( gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions )
00927             #endif
00928                   return FALSE;
00929             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to UnloadGenericButtonIcon that has no icon (already deleted)." );
00930       }
00931       // If an icon is present in the slot, remove it.
00932       DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonIcons[GenImg]);
00933       GenericButtonIcons[GenImg]=NULL;
00934       return TRUE;
00935 }
00936 
00937 
00938 
00939 //=============================================================================
00940 //    UnloadGenericButtonImage
00941 //
00942 //    Removes the images associated with a generic button. Except the icon
00943 //    image of iconic buttons. See above.
00944 //
00945 BOOLEAN UnloadGenericButtonImage(INT16 GenImg)
00946 {
00947       BOOLEAN fDeletedSomething = FALSE;
00948       if( GenImg < 0 || GenImg >= MAX_GENERIC_PICS  )
00949       {
00950             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to UnloadGenericButtonImage with out of range index %d.", GenImg );
00951             AssertMsg( 0, str );
00952       }
00953 
00954       // For each possible image type in a generic button, check if it's
00955       // present, and if so, remove it.
00956       if(GenericButtonGrayed[GenImg]!=NULL)
00957       {
00958             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonGrayed[GenImg]);
00959             GenericButtonGrayed[GenImg]=NULL;
00960             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00961       }
00962 
00963       if(GenericButtonOffNormal[GenImg]!=NULL)
00964       {
00965             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOffNormal[GenImg]);
00966             GenericButtonOffNormal[GenImg]=NULL;
00967             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00968       }
00969 
00970       if(GenericButtonOffHilite[GenImg]!=NULL)
00971       {
00972             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOffHilite[GenImg]);
00973             GenericButtonOffHilite[GenImg]=NULL;
00974             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00975       }
00976 
00977       if(GenericButtonOnNormal[GenImg]!=NULL)
00978       {
00979             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOnNormal[GenImg]);
00980             GenericButtonOnNormal[GenImg]=NULL;
00981             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00982       }
00983 
00984       if(GenericButtonOnHilite[GenImg]!=NULL)
00985       {
00986             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOnHilite[GenImg]);
00987             GenericButtonOnHilite[GenImg]=NULL;
00988             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00989       }
00990 
00991       if(GenericButtonBackground[GenImg]!=NULL)
00992       {
00993             DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonBackground[GenImg]);
00994             GenericButtonBackground[GenImg]=NULL;
00995             fDeletedSomething = TRUE;
00996       }
00997 
00998       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
00999       if( !gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions && !fDeletedSomething )
01000             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to UnloadGenericButtonImage that has no images (already deleted)." );
01001       #endif
01002 
01003       // Reset the remaining variables
01004       GenericButtonFillColors[GenImg]=0;
01005       GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[GenImg]=0;
01006       GenericButtonOffsetX[GenImg]=0;
01007       GenericButtonOffsetY[GenImg]=0;
01008 
01009       return(TRUE);
01010 }
01011 
01012 
01013 
01014 //=============================================================================
01015 //    LoadGenericButtonImages
01016 //
01017 //    Loads the image files required for displaying a generic button.
01018 //
01019 INT16 LoadGenericButtonImages(UINT8 *GrayName,UINT8 *OffNormName,UINT8 *OffHiliteName,UINT8 *OnNormName,UINT8 *OnHiliteName,UINT8 *BkGrndName,INT16 Index,INT16 OffsetX, INT16 OffsetY)
01020 {
01021       INT16 ImgSlot;
01022       VOBJECT_DESC      vo_desc;
01023       UINT8 Pix;
01024 
01025       // if the images for Off-Normal and On-Normal don't exist, abort call
01026       if((OffNormName == BUTTON_NO_FILENAME) || (OnNormName == BUTTON_NO_FILENAME))
01027       {
01028             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "LoadGenericButtonImages: No filenames for OFFNORMAL and/or ONNORMAL images");
01029             return(-1);
01030       }
01031 
01032       // Get a slot number for these images
01033       if((ImgSlot=FindFreeGenericSlot()) == -1)
01034       {
01035             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "LoadGenericButtonImages: Out of generic button slots");
01036             return(-1);
01037       }
01038 
01039       // Load the image for the Off-Normal button state (required)
01040       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01041       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, OffNormName);
01042 
01043       if((GenericButtonOffNormal[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01044       {
01045             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",OffNormName));
01046             return(-1);
01047       }
01048 
01049       // Load the image for the On-Normal button state (required)
01050       vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01051       strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, OnNormName);
01052 
01053       if((GenericButtonOnNormal[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01054       {
01055             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",OnNormName));
01056             return(-1);
01057       }
01058 
01059       // For the optional button state images, see if a filename was given, and
01060       // if so, load it.
01061 
01062       if(GrayName != BUTTON_NO_FILENAME)
01063       {
01064             vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01065             strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, GrayName);
01066 
01067             if((GenericButtonGrayed[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01068             {
01069                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",GrayName));
01070                   return(-1);
01071             }
01072       }
01073       else
01074             GenericButtonGrayed[ImgSlot] = NULL;
01075 
01076       if(OffHiliteName != BUTTON_NO_FILENAME)
01077       {
01078             vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01079             strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, OffHiliteName);
01080 
01081             if((GenericButtonOffHilite[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01082             {
01083                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",OffHiliteName));
01084                   return(-1);
01085             }
01086       }
01087       else
01088             GenericButtonOffHilite[ImgSlot] = NULL;
01089 
01090       if(OnHiliteName != BUTTON_NO_FILENAME)
01091       {
01092             vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01093             strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, OnHiliteName);
01094 
01095             if((GenericButtonOnHilite[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01096             {
01097                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",OnHiliteName));
01098                   return(-1);
01099             }
01100       }
01101       else
01102             GenericButtonOnHilite[ImgSlot] = NULL;
01103 
01104       if(BkGrndName != BUTTON_NO_FILENAME)
01105       {
01106             vo_desc.fCreateFlags = VOBJECT_CREATE_FROMFILE;
01107             strcpy(vo_desc.ImageFile, BkGrndName);
01108 
01109             if((GenericButtonBackground[ImgSlot] = CreateVideoObject(&vo_desc)) == NULL)
01110             {
01111                   DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't create VOBJECT for %s",BkGrndName));
01112                   return(-1);
01113             }
01114       }
01115       else
01116             GenericButtonBackground[ImgSlot] = NULL;
01117 
01118       GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[ImgSlot]=Index;
01119 
01120       // Get the background fill color from the last (9th) sub-image in the
01121       // Off-Normal image.
01122       Pix=0;
01123       if(!GetETRLEPixelValue(&Pix,GenericButtonOffNormal[ImgSlot],8,0,0))
01124       {
01125             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER, DBG_LEVEL_0, "LoadGenericButtonImages: Couldn't get generic button's background pixel value");
01126             return(-1);
01127       }
01128 
01129       GenericButtonFillColors[ImgSlot]=GenericButtonOffNormal[ImgSlot]->p16BPPPalette[Pix];
01130 
01131       // Set the button's background image adjustement offsets
01132       GenericButtonOffsetX[ImgSlot]=OffsetX;
01133       GenericButtonOffsetY[ImgSlot]=OffsetY;
01134 
01135       // Return the slot number used.
01136       return(ImgSlot);
01137 }
01138 
01139 
01140 //=============================================================================
01141 //    ShutdownButtonImageManager
01142 //
01143 //    Cleans up, and shuts down the button image manager sub-system.
01144 //
01145 //    This function is called by ShutdownButtonSystem.
01146 //
01147 void ShutdownButtonImageManager(void)
01148 {
01149       int x;
01150 
01151       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01152       gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions = TRUE;
01153       #endif
01154 
01155       // Remove all QuickButton images
01156       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTON_PICS;x++)
01157             UnloadButtonImage(x);
01158 
01159       // Remove all GenericButton images
01160       for(x=0;x<MAX_GENERIC_PICS;x++)
01161       {
01162             if(GenericButtonGrayed[x]!=NULL)
01163             {
01164                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonGrayed[x]);
01165                   GenericButtonGrayed[x]=NULL;
01166             }
01167 
01168             if(GenericButtonOffNormal[x]!=NULL)
01169             {
01170                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOffNormal[x]);
01171                   GenericButtonOffNormal[x]=NULL;
01172             }
01173 
01174             if(GenericButtonOffHilite[x]!=NULL)
01175             {
01176                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOffHilite[x]);
01177                   GenericButtonOffHilite[x]=NULL;
01178             }
01179 
01180             if(GenericButtonOnNormal[x]!=NULL)
01181             {
01182                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOnNormal[x]);
01183                   GenericButtonOnNormal[x]=NULL;
01184             }
01185 
01186             if(GenericButtonOnHilite[x]!=NULL)
01187             {
01188                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonOnHilite[x]);
01189                   GenericButtonOnHilite[x]=NULL;
01190             }
01191 
01192             if(GenericButtonBackground[x]!=NULL)
01193             {
01194                   DeleteVideoObject(GenericButtonBackground[x]);
01195                   GenericButtonBackground[x]=NULL;
01196             }
01197 
01198             GenericButtonFillColors[x]=0;
01199             GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[x]=0;
01200             GenericButtonOffsetX[x]=0;
01201             GenericButtonOffsetY[x]=0;
01202       }
01203 
01204       // Remove all button icons
01205       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTON_ICONS;x++)
01206       {
01207             if(GenericButtonIcons[x]!=NULL)
01208                   GenericButtonIcons[x]=NULL;
01209       }
01210 }
01211 
01212 
01213 
01214 //=============================================================================
01215 //    InitButtonSystem
01216 //
01217 //    Initializes the GUI button system for use. Must be called before using
01218 //    any other button functions.
01219 //
01220 BOOLEAN InitButtonSystem(void)
01221 {
01222       INT32 x;
01223 
01224       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01225       gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions = FALSE;
01226       #endif
01227 
01228       RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,"Button System & Button Image Manager");
01229 
01230       // Clear out button list
01231       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTONS;x++)
01232       {
01233             ButtonList[x]=NULL;
01234       }
01235 
01236       // Initialize the button image manager sub-system
01237       if(InitializeButtonImageManager(-1,-1,-1) == FALSE)
01238       {
01239             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"Failed button image manager init\n");
01240             return(FALSE);
01241       }
01242 
01243       ButtonsInList = 0;
01244 
01245       return(TRUE);
01246 }
01247 
01248 
01249 
01250 //=============================================================================
01251 //    ShutdownButtonSystem
01252 //
01253 //    Shuts down and cleans up the GUI button system. Must be called before
01254 //    exiting the program. Button functions should not be used after calling
01255 //    this function.
01256 //
01257 void ShutdownButtonSystem(void)
01258 {
01259       int x;
01260 
01261       // Kill off all buttons in the system
01262       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTONS;x++)
01263       {
01264             if(ButtonList[x]!=NULL)
01265                   RemoveButton(x);
01266       }
01267       // Shutdown the button image manager sub-system
01268       ShutdownButtonImageManager();
01269 
01270       UnRegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,"Button System & Button Image Manager");
01271 }
01272 
01273 void RemoveButtonsMarkedForDeletion()
01274 {
01275       INT32 i;
01276       for( i = 0; i < MAX_BUTTONS; i++ )
01277       {
01278             if( ButtonList[ i ] && ButtonList[ i ]->uiFlags & BUTTON_DELETION_PENDING )
01279             {
01280                   RemoveButton( i );
01281             }
01282       }
01283 }
01284 
01285 //=============================================================================
01286 //    RemoveButton
01287 //
01288 //    Removes a button from the system's list. All memory associated with the
01289 //    button is released.
01290 //
01291 void RemoveButton(INT32 iButtonID)
01292 {
01293       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01294 
01295       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
01296       {
01297             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to RemoveButton with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
01298             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01299       }
01300 
01301       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
01302 
01303       // If button exists...
01304       if( !b )
01305       {
01306             #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01307             if( gfIgnoreShutdownAssertions )
01308             #endif
01309                   return;
01310             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to remove a button that has already been deleted." );
01311       }
01312 
01313       //If we happen to be in the middle of a callback, and attempt to delete a button,
01314       //like deleting a node during list processing, then we delay it till after the callback
01315       //is completed.
01316       if( gfDelayButtonDeletion )
01317       {
01318             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DELETION_PENDING;
01319             gfPendingButtonDeletion = TRUE;
01320             return;
01321       }
01322 
01323       //Kris:
01324       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SELFDELETE_IMAGE )
01325       { //checkboxes and simple create buttons have their own graphics associated with them,
01326             //and it is handled internally.  We delete it here.  This provides the advantage of less
01327             //micromanagement, but with the disadvantage of wasting more memory if you have lots of
01328             //buttons using the same graphics.
01329             UnloadButtonImage( b->ImageNum );
01330       }
01331 
01332       // ...kill it!!!
01333       MSYS_RemoveRegion(&b->Area);
01334 
01335 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01336       if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND )
01337       {
01338             FreeBackgroundRectPending(b->BackRect);
01339       }
01340 #endif
01341 
01342       // Get rid of the text string
01343       if (b->string != NULL)
01344             MemFree( b->string );
01345 
01346       if( b == gpAnchoredButton )
01347             gpAnchoredButton = NULL;
01348       if( b == gpPrevAnchoredButton )
01349             gpPrevAnchoredButton = NULL;
01350 
01351       MemFree(b);
01352       b=NULL;
01353       ButtonList[ iButtonID ] = NULL;
01354 }
01355 
01356 
01357 
01358 //=============================================================================
01359 //    GetNextButtonNumber
01360 //
01361 //    Finds the next available button slot.
01362 //
01363 INT32 GetNextButtonNumber(void)
01364 {
01365       INT32 x;
01366 
01367       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTONS;x++)
01368       {
01369             if(ButtonList[x] == NULL)
01370                   return(x);
01371       }
01372 
01373       return(BUTTON_NO_SLOT);
01374 }
01375 
01376 
01377 
01378 //=============================================================================
01379 //    ResizeButton
01380 //
01381 //    Changes the size of a generic button.
01382 //
01383 //    QuickButtons cannot be resized, therefore this function ignores the
01384 //    call if a QuickButton is given.
01385 //
01386 void ResizeButton(INT32 iButtonID,INT16 w, INT16 h)
01387 {
01388       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01389       INT32 xloc,yloc;
01390 
01391       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
01392       {
01393             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to resize button with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
01394             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01395       }
01396 
01397       // if button size is too small, adjust it.
01398       if(w<4)
01399             w=4;
01400       if(h<3)
01401             h=3;
01402 
01403       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
01404 
01405       if( !b )
01406       {
01407             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to resize deleted button with buttonID %d", iButtonID );
01408             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01409       }
01410 
01411       // If this is a QuickButton, ignore this call
01412       if((b->uiFlags & BUTTON_TYPES) == BUTTON_QUICK)
01413             return;
01414 
01415       // Get current button screen location
01416       xloc=b->XLoc;
01417       yloc=b->YLoc;
01418 
01419       // Set the new MOUSE_REGION area values to reflect change in size.
01420       b->Area.RegionTopLeftX=(UINT16)xloc;
01421       b->Area.RegionTopLeftY=(UINT16)yloc;
01422       b->Area.RegionBottomRightX=(UINT16)(xloc+w);
01423       b->Area.RegionBottomRightY=(UINT16)(yloc+h);
01424       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
01425 
01426 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01427       if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND )
01428       {
01429             FreeBackgroundRectPending(b->BackRect);
01430             b->BackRect = RegisterBackgroundRect(BGND_FLAG_PERMANENT | BGND_FLAG_SAVERECT, NULL,
01431                               (INT16)xloc, (INT16)yloc, (INT16)(xloc+w), (INT16)(yloc+h) );
01432       }
01433 #endif
01434 
01435 }
01436 
01437 
01438 
01439 //=============================================================================
01440 //    SetButtonPosition
01441 //
01442 //    Sets the position of a button on the screen. The position is relative
01443 //    to the top left corner of the button.
01444 //
01445 void SetButtonPosition( INT32 iButtonID ,INT16 x, INT16 y)
01446 {
01447       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01448       INT32 xloc,yloc,w,h;
01449 
01450       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
01451       {
01452             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to set button position with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
01453             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01454       }
01455 
01456       b=ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
01457 
01458       if( !b )
01459       {
01460             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to set button position with buttonID %d", iButtonID );
01461             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01462       }
01463 
01464       // Get new screen position
01465       xloc=(INT16)x;
01466       yloc=(INT16)y;
01467       // Compute current width and height of this button
01468       w = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
01469       h = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
01470 
01471       // Set button to new location
01472       b->XLoc=x;
01473       b->YLoc=y;
01474       // Set the buttons MOUSE_REGION to appropriate area
01475       b->Area.RegionTopLeftX=(UINT16)xloc;
01476       b->Area.RegionTopLeftY=(UINT16)yloc;
01477       b->Area.RegionBottomRightX=(UINT16)(xloc+w);
01478       b->Area.RegionBottomRightY=(UINT16)(yloc+h);
01479       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
01480 
01481 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01482       if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND )
01483       {
01484             FreeBackgroundRectPending(b->BackRect);
01485             b->BackRect = RegisterBackgroundRect(BGND_FLAG_PERMANENT | BGND_FLAG_SAVERECT, NULL,
01486                                     (INT16)xloc, (INT16)yloc, (INT16)(xloc+w), (INT16)(yloc+h) );
01487       }
01488 #endif
01489 
01490 }
01491 
01492 //=============================================================================
01493 //    SetButtonIcon
01494 //
01495 //    Sets the icon to be displayed on a IconicButton.
01496 //
01497 //    Calling this function with a button type other than Iconic has no effect.
01498 //
01499 INT32 SetButtonIcon( INT32 iButtonID, INT16 Icon, INT16 IconIndex )
01500 {
01501       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01502 
01503       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID >= MAX_BUTTONS )
01504       {
01505             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to set button icon with out of range buttonID %d.", iButtonID );
01506             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01507             return -1;
01508       }
01509       if( Icon < 0 || Icon >= MAX_BUTTON_ICONS )
01510       {
01511             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to set button[%d] icon with out of range icon index %d.", iButtonID, Icon );
01512             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01513             return -1;
01514       }
01515 
01516       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
01517 
01518       if( !b )
01519       {
01520             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to set deleted button icon with buttonID %d", iButtonID );
01521             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01522             return -1;
01523       }
01524 
01525       // If button isn't an icon button, ignore this call
01526       if(((b->uiFlags & BUTTON_TYPES) == BUTTON_QUICK) ||
01527              ((b->uiFlags & BUTTON_TYPES) == BUTTON_HOT_SPOT) ||
01528              ((b->uiFlags & BUTTON_TYPES) == BUTTON_GENERIC))
01529       {
01530             return -1;
01531       }
01532 
01533       // Set the icon number and index to use for this button
01534       b->iIconID = Icon;
01535       b->usIconIndex = IconIndex;
01536 
01537       return Icon;
01538 }
01539 
01540 
01541 
01542 //=============================================================================
01543 //    CreateIconButton
01544 //
01545 //    Creates an Iconic type button.
01546 //
01547 INT32 CreateIconButton(INT16 Icon,INT16 IconIndex,INT16 GenImg,INT16 xloc,INT16 yloc,INT16 w,INT16 h,INT32 Type,INT16 Priority,GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback,GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
01548 {
01549       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01550       INT32 ButtonNum;
01551       INT32 BType,x;
01552 
01553       if( xloc < 0 || yloc < 0 )
01554       {
01555             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateIconButton with invalid position of %d,%d", xloc, yloc );
01556             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01557       }
01558       if( GenImg < -1 || GenImg >= MAX_GENERIC_PICS )
01559       {
01560             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateIconButton with out of range iconID %d.", GenImg );
01561             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01562       }
01563 
01564       // if button size is too small, adjust it.
01565       if(w<4)
01566             w=4;
01567       if(h<3)
01568             h=3;
01569 
01570       // Strip off any extraneous bits from button type
01571       BType = Type & ( BUTTON_TYPE_MASK | BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE );
01572 
01573       // Get a button number (slot) for this new button
01574       if((ButtonNum = GetNextButtonNumber()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
01575       {
01576             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateIconButton: No more button slots");
01577             return(-1);
01578       }
01579 
01580       // Allocate memory for the GUI_BUTTON structure
01581       if((b=(GUI_BUTTON *)MemAlloc(sizeof(GUI_BUTTON))) == NULL)
01582       {
01583             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateIconButton: Can't alloc mem for button struct");
01584             return(-1);
01585       }
01586 
01587       // Init the values in the struct
01588       b->uiFlags = BUTTON_DIRTY;
01589       b->uiOldFlags = 0;
01590       b->IDNum = ButtonNum;
01591       b->XLoc = xloc;
01592       b->YLoc = yloc;
01593 
01594       if(GenImg<0)
01595             b->ImageNum = 0;
01596       else
01597             b->ImageNum = GenImg;
01598 
01599       for(x=0;x<4;x++)
01600             b->UserData[x] = 0;
01601       b->Group = -1;
01602 
01603       b->bDefaultStatus = DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE;
01604       b->bDisabledStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT;
01605       //Init text
01606       b->string = NULL;
01607       b->usFont = 0;
01608       b->fMultiColor=FALSE;
01609       b->sForeColor = 0;
01610       b->sWrappedWidth = -1;
01611       b->sShadowColor = -1;
01612       b->sForeColorDown = -1;
01613       b->sShadowColorDown = -1;
01614       b->sForeColorHilited = -1;
01615       b->sShadowColorHilited = -1;
01616       b->bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
01617       b->bTextXOffset = -1;
01618       b->bTextYOffset = -1;
01619       b->bTextXSubOffSet = 0;
01620       b->bTextYSubOffSet = 0;
01621       b->fShiftText = TRUE;
01622       //Init icon
01623       b->iIconID = Icon;
01624       b->usIconIndex = IconIndex;
01625       b->bIconXOffset = -1;
01626       b->bIconYOffset = -1;
01627       b->fShiftImage = TRUE;
01628 
01629       // Set the click callback function (if any)
01630       if(ClickCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01631       {
01632             b->ClickCallback = ClickCallback;
01633             BType |= BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK;
01634       }
01635       else
01636             b->ClickCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01637 
01638       // Set the move callback function (if any)
01639       if(MoveCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01640       {
01641             b->MoveCallback = MoveCallback;
01642             BType |= BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK;
01643       }
01644       else
01645             b->MoveCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01646 
01647       // Define a mouse region for this button
01648       MSYS_DefineRegion(&b->Area, (UINT16)xloc, (UINT16)yloc, (UINT16)(xloc+w), (UINT16)(yloc+h),
01649                         (INT8)Priority, MSYS_STARTING_CURSORVAL, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMMove, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMButn);
01650 
01651       // Link the mouse region to this button (for callback purposes)
01652       MSYS_SetRegionUserData(&b->Area,0,ButtonNum);
01653 
01654       // Set this button's flags
01655       b->uiFlags |= ( BUTTON_ENABLED | BType | BUTTON_GENERIC );
01656 
01657 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01658       b->BackRect = -1;
01659 #endif
01660 
01661       // WANNE 2
01662       // Add button to the button list
01663       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01664       AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( b );
01665       #endif
01666       ButtonList[ButtonNum]=b;
01667 
01668       SpecifyButtonSoundScheme( b->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_SCHEME_GENERIC );
01669 
01670       // return this button's slot number
01671       return(ButtonNum);
01672 }
01673 
01674 //Creates a generic button with text on it.
01675 INT32 CreateTextButton(UINT16 *string, UINT32 uiFont, INT16 sForeColor, INT16 sShadowColor, INT16 GenImg, INT16 xloc, INT16 yloc, INT16 w, INT16 h, INT32 Type, INT16 Priority,GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
01676 {
01677       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01678       INT32 ButtonNum;
01679       INT32 BType,x;
01680 
01681       if( xloc < 0 || yloc < 0 )
01682       {
01683             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateTextButton with invalid position of %d,%d", xloc, yloc );
01684             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01685       }
01686       if( GenImg < -1 || GenImg >= MAX_GENERIC_PICS )
01687       {
01688             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateTextButton with out of range iconID %d.", GenImg );
01689             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01690       }
01691 
01692       // if button size is too small, adjust it.
01693       if(w<4)
01694             w=4;
01695       if(h<3)
01696             h=3;
01697 
01698       // Strip off any extraneous bits from button type
01699       BType = Type & ( BUTTON_TYPE_MASK | BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE );
01700 
01701       // Get a button number for this new button
01702       if((ButtonNum = GetNextButtonNumber()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
01703       {
01704             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateTextButton: No more button slots");
01705             return(-1);
01706       }
01707 
01708       // Allocate memory for a GUI_BUTTON structure
01709       if((b=(GUI_BUTTON *)MemAlloc(sizeof(GUI_BUTTON))) == NULL)
01710       {
01711             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateTextButton: Can't alloc mem for button struct");
01712             return(-1);
01713       }
01714 
01715       // Allocate memory for the button's text string...
01716       b->string = NULL;
01717       if ( string && wcslen( string ) )
01718       {
01719             b->string = (UINT16*)MemAlloc( (wcslen(string)+1)*sizeof(UINT16) );
01720             AssertMsg( b->string, "Out of memory error:  Couldn't allocate string in CreateTextButton." );
01721             wcscpy( b->string, string );
01722       }
01723 
01724       // Init the button structure variables
01725       b->uiFlags = BUTTON_DIRTY;
01726       b->uiOldFlags = 0;
01727       b->IDNum = ButtonNum;
01728       b->XLoc = xloc;
01729       b->YLoc = yloc;
01730 
01731       if(GenImg<0)
01732             b->ImageNum = 0;
01733       else
01734             b->ImageNum = GenImg;
01735 
01736       for(x=0;x<4;x++)
01737             b->UserData[x] = 0;
01738       b->Group = -1;
01739       b->bDefaultStatus = DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE;
01740       b->bDisabledStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT;
01741       //Init string
01742       b->usFont = (UINT16)uiFont;
01743       b->fMultiColor=FALSE;
01744       b->sForeColor = sForeColor;
01745       b->sWrappedWidth = -1;
01746       b->sShadowColor = sShadowColor;
01747       b->sForeColorDown = -1;
01748       b->sShadowColorDown = -1;
01749       b->sForeColorHilited = -1;
01750       b->sShadowColorHilited = -1;
01751       b->bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
01752       b->bTextXOffset = -1;
01753       b->bTextYOffset = -1;
01754       b->bTextXSubOffSet = 0;
01755       b->bTextYSubOffSet = 0;
01756       b->fShiftText = TRUE;
01757       //Init icon
01758       b->iIconID = -1;
01759       b->usIconIndex = -1;
01760       b->bIconXOffset = -1;
01761       b->bIconYOffset = -1;
01762       b->fShiftImage = TRUE;
01763 
01764       // Set the button click callback function (if any)
01765       if(ClickCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01766       {
01767             b->ClickCallback = ClickCallback;
01768             BType |= BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK;
01769       }
01770       else
01771             b->ClickCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01772 
01773       // Set the button's mouse movement callback function (if any)
01774       if(MoveCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01775       {
01776             b->MoveCallback = MoveCallback;
01777             BType |= BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK;
01778       }
01779       else
01780             b->MoveCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01781 
01782       // Define a MOUSE_REGION for this button
01783       MSYS_DefineRegion(&b->Area, (UINT16)xloc, (UINT16)yloc, (UINT16)(xloc+w), (UINT16)(yloc+h),
01784                         (INT8)Priority, MSYS_STARTING_CURSORVAL, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMMove, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMButn);
01785 
01786       // Link the MOUSE_REGION to this button
01787       MSYS_SetRegionUserData(&b->Area,0,ButtonNum);
01788 
01789       // Set the flags for this button
01790       b->uiFlags |= ( BUTTON_ENABLED | BType | BUTTON_GENERIC);
01791 
01792 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01793       b->BackRect = -1;
01794 #endif
01795 
01796       // Add this button to the button list
01797       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01798       AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( b );
01799       #endif
01800       ButtonList[ButtonNum]=b;
01801 
01802       SpecifyButtonSoundScheme( b->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_SCHEME_GENERIC );
01803 
01804       // return the slot number
01805       return(ButtonNum);
01806 }
