01809 
01810 //=============================================================================
01811 //    CreateHotSpot
01812 //
01813 //    Creates a button like HotSpot. HotSpots have no graphics associated with
01814 //    them.
01815 //
01816 INT32 CreateHotSpot(INT16 xloc, INT16 yloc, INT16 Width, INT16 Height,INT16 Priority,GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback,GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
01817 {
01818       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01819       INT32 ButtonNum;
01820       INT16 BType,x;
01821 
01822       if( xloc < 0 || yloc < 0 || Width < 0 || Height < 0 )
01823       {
01824             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateHotSpot with invalid coordinates: %d,%d, width: %d, and height: %d.",
01825                   xloc, yloc, Width, Height );
01826             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01827       }
01828 
01829       BType=0;
01830 
01831       // Get a button number for this hotspot
01832       if((ButtonNum = GetNextButtonNumber()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
01833       {
01834             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateHotSpot: No more button slots");
01835             return(-1);
01836       }
01837 
01838       // Allocate memory for the GUI_BUTTON structure
01839       if((b=(GUI_BUTTON *)MemAlloc(sizeof(GUI_BUTTON))) == NULL)
01840       {
01841             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateHotSpot: Can't alloc mem for button struct");
01842             return(-1);
01843       }
01844 
01845       // Init the structure values
01846       b->uiFlags = 0;
01847       b->uiOldFlags = 0;
01848       b->IDNum = ButtonNum;
01849       b->XLoc = xloc;
01850       b->YLoc = yloc;
01851       b->ImageNum = 0xffffffff;
01852       for(x=0;x<4;x++)
01853             b->UserData[x] = 0;
01854       b->Group = -1;
01855       b->string = NULL;
01856 
01857       // Set the hotspot click callback function (if any)
01858       if(ClickCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01859       {
01860             b->ClickCallback = ClickCallback;
01861             BType |= BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK;
01862       }
01863       else
01864             b->ClickCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01865 
01866       // Set the hotspot's mouse movement callback function (if any)
01867       if(MoveCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
01868       {
01869             b->MoveCallback = MoveCallback;
01870             BType |= BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK;
01871       }
01872       else
01873             b->MoveCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
01874 
01875       // define a MOUSE_REGION for this hotspot
01876       MSYS_DefineRegion(&b->Area,(UINT16)xloc,(UINT16)yloc,(UINT16)(xloc+Width),(UINT16)(yloc+Height),
01877                         (INT8)Priority, MSYS_STARTING_CURSORVAL, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMMove, (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMButn);
01878 
01879       // Link the MOUSE_REGION to this hotspot
01880       MSYS_SetRegionUserData(&b->Area,0,ButtonNum);
01881 
01882       // Set the flags entry for this hotspot
01883       b->uiFlags |= (BUTTON_ENABLED|BType|BUTTON_HOT_SPOT);
01884 
01885 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
01886       b->BackRect = -1;
01887 #endif
01888 
01889       // Add this button (hotspot) to the button list
01890       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
01891       AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( b );
01892       #endif
01893       ButtonList[ButtonNum]=b;
01894 
01895       SpecifyButtonSoundScheme( b->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_SCHEME_GENERIC );
01896 
01897       // return the button slot number
01898       return(ButtonNum);
01899 }
01900 
01901 
01902 
01903 // ============================================================================
01904 // Addition Oct15/97, Carter
01905 // SetButtonCursor
01906 // will simply set the cursor for the mouse region the button occupies
01907 BOOLEAN SetButtonCursor(INT32 iBtnId, UINT16 crsr)
01908 {
01909   GUI_BUTTON *b;
01910   b = ButtonList[iBtnId];
01911       if (!b)
01912             return FALSE;
01913   b->Area.Cursor = crsr;
01914       return TRUE;
01915 }
01916 
01917 //=============================================================================
01918 //    QuickCreateButton
01919 //
01920 //    Creates a QuickButton. QuickButtons only have graphics associated with
01921 //    them. They cannot be re-sized, nor can the graphic be changed.
01922 //
01923 INT32 QuickCreateButton(UINT32 Image,INT16 xloc,INT16 yloc,INT32 Type,INT16 Priority,GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback,GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
01924 {
01925       GUI_BUTTON *b;
01926       INT32 ButtonNum;
01927       INT32 BType,x;
01928 
01929       if( xloc < 0 || yloc < 0 )
01930       {
01931             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to QuickCreateButton with invalid position of %d,%d", xloc, yloc );
01932             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01933       }
01934       if( Image < 0 || Image >= MAX_BUTTON_PICS )
01935       {
01936             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to QuickCreateButton with out of range ImageID %d.", Image );
01937             AssertMsg( 0, str );
01938       }
01939 
01940       // Strip off any extraneous bits from button type
01941       BType = Type & ( BUTTON_TYPE_MASK | BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE );
01942 
01943       // Is there a QuickButton image in the given image slot?
01944       if(ButtonPictures[Image].vobj == NULL)
01945       {
01946             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: Invalid button image number");
01947             return(-1);
01948       }
01949 
01950       // Get a new button number
01951       if((ButtonNum = GetNextButtonNumber()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
01952       {
01953             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: No more button slots");
01954             return(-1);
01955       }
01956 
01957       // Allocate memory for a GUI_BUTTON structure
01958       if((b=(GUI_BUTTON *)MemAlloc(sizeof(GUI_BUTTON))) == NULL)
01959       {
01960             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: Can't alloc mem for button struct");
01961             return(-1);
01962       }
01963 
01964       // Set the values for this buttn
01965       b->uiFlags = BUTTON_DIRTY;
01966       b->uiOldFlags = 0;
01967 
01968       // Set someflags if of s certain type....
01969       if ( Type & BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE )
01970       {
01971             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE;
01972       }
01973 
01974       // shadow style
01975       b->bDefaultStatus = DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE;
01976       b->bDisabledStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT;
01977 
01978       b->Group = -1;
01979       //Init string
01980       b->string = NULL;
01981       b->usFont = 0;
01982       b->fMultiColor=FALSE;
01983       b->sForeColor = 0;
01984       b->sWrappedWidth = -1;
01985       b->sShadowColor = -1;
01986       b->sForeColorDown = -1;
01987       b->sShadowColorDown = -1;
01988       b->sForeColorHilited = -1;
01989       b->sShadowColorHilited = -1;
01990       b->bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
01991       b->bTextXOffset = -1;
01992       b->bTextYOffset = -1;
01993       b->bTextXSubOffSet = 0;
01994       b->bTextYSubOffSet = 0;
01995       b->fShiftText = TRUE;
01996       //Init icon
01997       b->iIconID = -1;
01998       b->usIconIndex = -1;
01999       b->bIconXOffset = -1;
02000       b->bIconYOffset = -1;
02001       b->fShiftImage = TRUE;
02002       //Init quickbutton
02003       b->IDNum = ButtonNum;
02004       b->ImageNum = Image;
02005       for(x=0;x<4;x++)
02006             b->UserData[x] = 0;
02007 
02008       b->XLoc = xloc;
02009       b->YLoc = yloc;
02010 
02011       b->ubToggleButtonOldState = 0;
02012       b->ubToggleButtonActivated = FALSE;
02013 
02014       // Set the button click callback function (if any)
02015       if(ClickCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
02016       {
02017             b->ClickCallback = ClickCallback;
02018             BType |= BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK;
02019       }
02020       else
02021             b->ClickCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
02022 
02023       // Set the button's mouse movement callback function (if any)
02024       if(MoveCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
02025       {
02026             b->MoveCallback = MoveCallback;
02027             BType |= BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK;
02028       }
02029       else
02030             b->MoveCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
02031 
02032       memset( &b->Area, 0, sizeof( MOUSE_REGION ) );
02033       // Define a MOUSE_REGION for this QuickButton
02034       MSYS_DefineRegion(&b->Area,(UINT16)xloc,(UINT16)yloc,
02035                     (UINT16)(xloc+(INT16)ButtonPictures[Image].MaxWidth),
02036                         (UINT16)(yloc+(INT16)ButtonPictures[Image].MaxHeight),
02037                         (INT8)Priority, MSYS_STARTING_CURSORVAL,
02038                         (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMMove,
02039                         (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMButn);
02040 
02041       // Link the MOUSE_REGION with this QuickButton
02042       MSYS_SetRegionUserData(&b->Area,0,ButtonNum);
02043 
02044       // Set the flags for this button
02045       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_ENABLED | BType | BUTTON_QUICK;
02046 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
02047       b->BackRect = -1;
02048 #endif
02049 
02050       // Add this QuickButton to the button list
02051       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
02052       AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( b );
02053       #endif
02054       ButtonList[ButtonNum]=b;
02055 
02056       SpecifyButtonSoundScheme( b->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_SCHEME_GENERIC );
02057 
02058       // return the button number (slot)
02059       return(ButtonNum);
02060 }
02061 
02062 //A hybrid of QuickCreateButton.  Takes a lot less parameters, but makes more assumptions.  It self manages the
02063 //loading, and deleting of the image.  The size of the image determines the size of the button.  It also uses
02064 //the default move callback which emulates Win95.  Finally, it sets the priority to normal.  The function you
02065 //choose also determines the type of button (toggle, notoggle, or newtoggle)
02066 template INT32 CreateEasyNoToggleButton<char *>(INT32, INT32, char *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02067 template INT32 CreateEasyNoToggleButton<char const *>(INT32, INT32, char const *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02068 template <typename string3>
02069 INT32 CreateEasyNoToggleButton ( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback )
02070 {
02071       return CreateSimpleButton( x, y, filename, BUTTON_NO_TOGGLE, MSYS_PRIORITY_NORMAL, ClickCallback );
02072 }
02073 
02074 template INT32 CreateEasyToggleButton<char *>(INT32, INT32, char *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02075 template INT32 CreateEasyToggleButton<char const *>(INT32, INT32, char const *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02076 template <typename string3>
02077 INT32 CreateEasyToggleButton   ( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback )
02078 {
02079       return CreateSimpleButton( x, y, filename, BUTTON_TOGGLE, MSYS_PRIORITY_NORMAL, ClickCallback );
02080 }
02081 
02082 template INT32 CreateEasyNewToggleButton<char const *>(INT32, INT32, char const *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02083 template INT32 CreateEasyNewToggleButton<short *>(INT32, INT32, short *, GUI_CALLBACK);
02084 template <typename string3>
02085 INT32 CreateEasyNewToggleButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback )
02086 {
02087       return CreateSimpleButton( x, y, filename, BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE, MSYS_PRIORITY_NORMAL, ClickCallback );
02088 }
02089 
02090 //Same as above, but accepts specify toggle type
02091 template INT32 CreateEasyButton<short *>(INT32, INT32, short *, INT32, GUI_CALLBACK);
02092 template <typename string3>
02093 INT32 CreateEasyButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, INT32 Type, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
02094 {
02095       return CreateSimpleButton( x, y, filename, Type, MSYS_PRIORITY_NORMAL, ClickCallback );
02096 }
02097 
02098 //Same as above, but accepts priority specification.
02099 template INT32 CreateSimpleButton<char *>(INT32, INT32, char *, INT32, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK);
02100 template INT32 CreateSimpleButton<char const *>(INT32, INT32, char const *, INT32, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK);
02101 template <typename string3>
02102 INT32 CreateSimpleButton( INT32 x, INT32 y, string3 filename, INT32 Type, INT16 Priority, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback )
02103 {
02104       INT32 ButPic,ButNum;
02105 
02106       if( !filename || !strlen(filename) )
02107             AssertMsg( 0, "Attempting to CreateSimpleButton with null filename." );
02108 
02109       if( ( ButPic = LoadButtonImage( filename, -1, 1, 2, 3, 4 ) ) == -1)
02110       {
02111             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"Can't load button image");
02112             return( -1 );
02113       }
02114 
02115       ButNum = (INT16)QuickCreateButton( ButPic, (INT16)x,(INT16)y, Type, Priority, DEFAULT_MOVE_CALLBACK, ClickCallback);
02116 
02117       AssertMsg( ButNum != -1, "Failed to CreateSimpleButton." );
02118 
02119       ButtonList[ ButNum ]->uiFlags |= BUTTON_SELFDELETE_IMAGE;
02120 
02121       SpecifyDisabledButtonStyle( ButNum, DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED );
02122 
02123       return( ButNum );
02124 }
02125 
02126 template INT32 CreateIconAndTextButton<unsigned short const *>(INT32, unsigned short const *, UINT32, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT8, INT16, INT16, INT32, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK, GUI_CALLBACK);
02127 template INT32 CreateIconAndTextButton<unsigned short *>(INT32, unsigned short *, UINT32, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT8, INT16, INT16, INT32, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK, GUI_CALLBACK);
02128 template INT32 CreateIconAndTextButton<short *>(INT32, short *, UINT32, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT16, INT8, INT16, INT16, INT32, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK, GUI_CALLBACK);
02129 template <typename string2>
02130 INT32 CreateIconAndTextButton( INT32 Image, string2 string, UINT32 uiFont,
02131                                                                                            INT16 sForeColor, INT16 sShadowColor,
02132                                                                                            INT16 sForeColorDown, INT16 sShadowColorDown,
02133                                                                                            INT8 bJustification,
02134                                                                                            INT16 xloc, INT16 yloc, INT32 Type, INT16 Priority,
02135                                                                                            GUI_CALLBACK MoveCallback,GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback)
02136 {
02137       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02138       INT32 iButtonID;
02139       INT32 BType,x;
02140 
02141       if( xloc < 0 || yloc < 0 )
02142       {
02143             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attempting to CreateIconAndTextButton with invalid position of %d,%d", xloc, yloc );
02144             AssertMsg( 0, str );
02145       }
02146       if( Image < 0 || Image >= MAX_BUTTON_PICS )
02147       {
02148             sprintf( (char *)str, "Attemting to CreateIconAndTextButton with out of range ImageID %d.", Image );
02149             AssertMsg( 0, str );
02150       }
02151 
02152       // Strip off any extraneous bits from button type
02153       BType = Type & ( BUTTON_TYPE_MASK | BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE );
02154 
02155       // Is there a QuickButton image in the given image slot?
02156       if(ButtonPictures[Image].vobj == NULL)
02157       {
02158             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: Invalid button image number");
02159             return(-1);
02160       }
02161 
02162       // Get a new button number
02163       if((iButtonID = GetNextButtonNumber()) == BUTTON_NO_SLOT)
02164       {
02165             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: No more button slots");
02166             return(-1);
02167       }
02168 
02169       // Allocate memory for a GUI_BUTTON structure
02170       if((b=(GUI_BUTTON *)MemAlloc(sizeof(GUI_BUTTON))) == NULL)
02171       {
02172             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"QuickCreateButton: Can't alloc mem for button struct");
02173             return(-1);
02174       }
02175 
02176       // Set the values for this button
02177       b->uiFlags = BUTTON_DIRTY;
02178       b->uiOldFlags = 0;
02179       b->IDNum = iButtonID;
02180       b->XLoc = xloc;
02181       b->YLoc = yloc;
02182       b->ImageNum = Image;
02183       for(x=0;x<4;x++)
02184             b->UserData[x] = 0;
02185       b->Group = -1;
02186       b->bDefaultStatus = DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE;
02187       b->bDisabledStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT;
02188 
02189       // Allocate memory for the button's text string...
02190       b->string = NULL;
02191       if ( string  )
02192       {
02193             b->string = (UINT16*)MemAlloc( (wcslen((wchar_t *)string)+1)*sizeof(UINT16) );
02194             AssertMsg( b->string, "Out of memory error:  Couldn't allocate string in CreateIconAndTextButton." );
02195             wcscpy( b->string, string );
02196       }
02197 
02198       b->bJustification = bJustification;
02199       b->usFont = (UINT16)uiFont;
02200       b->fMultiColor=FALSE;
02201       b->sForeColor = sForeColor;
02202       b->sWrappedWidth = -1;
02203       b->sShadowColor = sShadowColor;
02204       b->sForeColorDown = sForeColorDown;
02205       b->sShadowColorDown = sShadowColorDown;
02206       b->sForeColorHilited = -1;
02207       b->sShadowColorHilited = -1;
02208       b->bTextXOffset = -1;
02209       b->bTextYOffset = -1;
02210       b->bTextXSubOffSet = 0;
02211       b->bTextYSubOffSet = 0;
02212       b->fShiftText = TRUE;
02213 
02214       b->iIconID = -1;
02215       b->usIconIndex = 0;
02216 
02217       // Set the button click callback function (if any)
02218       if(ClickCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
02219       {
02220             b->ClickCallback = ClickCallback;
02221             BType |= BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK;
02222       }
02223       else
02224             b->ClickCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
02225 
02226       // Set the button's mouse movement callback function (if any)
02227       if(MoveCallback != BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK)
02228       {
02229             b->MoveCallback = MoveCallback;
02230             BType |= BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK;
02231       }
02232       else
02233             b->MoveCallback = BUTTON_NO_CALLBACK;
02234 
02235       // Define a MOUSE_REGION for this QuickButton
02236       MSYS_DefineRegion(&b->Area,(UINT16)xloc,(UINT16)yloc,
02237                     (UINT16)(xloc+(INT16)ButtonPictures[Image].MaxWidth),
02238                         (UINT16)(yloc+(INT16)ButtonPictures[Image].MaxHeight),
02239                         (INT8)Priority, MSYS_STARTING_CURSORVAL,
02240                         (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMMove,
02241                         (MOUSE_CALLBACK)QuickButtonCallbackMButn);
02242 
02243       // Link the MOUSE_REGION with this QuickButton
02244       MSYS_SetRegionUserData(&b->Area,0,iButtonID);
02245 
02246       // Set the flags for this button
02247       b->uiFlags |= ( BUTTON_ENABLED | BType | BUTTON_QUICK );
02248 
02249 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
02250       b->BackRect = -1;
02251 #endif
02252 
02253       // Add this QuickButton to the button list
02254       #ifdef BUTTONSYSTEM_DEBUGGING
02255       AssertFailIfIdenticalButtonAttributesFound( b );
02256       #endif
02257       ButtonList[iButtonID]=b;
02258 
02259       SpecifyButtonSoundScheme( b->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_SCHEME_GENERIC );
02260 
02261       // return the button number (slot)
02262       return(iButtonID);
02263 }
02264 
02265 //New functions
02266 void SpecifyButtonText( INT32 iButtonID, UINT16 * string )
02267 {
02268       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02269 
02270       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02271       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02272 
02273       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02274 
02275       //free the previous strings memory if applicable
02276       if( b->string )
02277             MemFree( b->string );
02278       b->string = NULL;
02279 
02280       if( string && wcslen( string ) )
02281       {
02282             //allocate memory for the new string
02283             b->string = (UINT16*)MemAlloc( (wcslen(string)+1)*sizeof(UINT16) );
02284             Assert( b->string );
02285             //copy the string to the button
02286             wcscpy( b->string, string );
02287             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02288       }
02289 }

02349 void SpecifyButtonTextJustification( INT32 iButtonID, INT8 bJustification )
02350 {
02351       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02352       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02353       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02354       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02355       Assert( b );
02356       //Range check:  if invalid, then set it to center justified.
02357       if( bJustification < BUTTON_TEXT_LEFT || bJustification > BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT )
02358             bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
02359       b->bJustification = bJustification;
02360       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY ;
02361 }

02363 void SpecifyFullButtonTextAttributes( INT32 iButtonID, UINT16 *string, INT32 uiFont,
02364                                                                                                                   INT16 sForeColor, INT16 sShadowColor,
02365                                                                                                                   INT16 sForeColorDown, INT16 sShadowColorDown, INT8 bJustification )
02366 {
02367       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02368       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02369       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02370       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02371       Assert( b );
02372       //Copy over information
02373       SpecifyButtonText( iButtonID, string );
02374       b->usFont = (UINT16)uiFont;
02375       b->sForeColor = sForeColor;
02376       b->sShadowColor = sShadowColor;
02377       b->sForeColorDown = sForeColorDown;
02378       b->sShadowColorDown = sShadowColorDown;
02379       //Range check:  if invalid, then set it to center justified.
02380       if( bJustification < BUTTON_TEXT_LEFT || bJustification > BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT )
02381             bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
02382       b->bJustification = bJustification;
02383       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY ;
02384 }

02453 
02454 //Note:  Text is always on top
02455 //If fShiftImage is true, then the image will shift down one pixel and right one pixel
02456 //just like the text does.
02457 BOOLEAN SpecifyButtonIcon( INT32 iButtonID, INT32 iVideoObjectID, UINT16 usVideoObjectIndex,
02458                                                                                INT8 bXOffset, INT8 bYOffset, BOOLEAN fShiftImage )
02459 {
02460       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02461 
02462       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02463       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02464       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02465       Assert( b );
02466 
02467       b->iIconID = iVideoObjectID;
02468       b->usIconIndex = usVideoObjectIndex;
02469 
02470       if( b->iIconID == -1 )
02471             return FALSE;
02472 
02473       b->bIconXOffset = bXOffset;
02474       b->bIconYOffset = bYOffset;
02475       b->fShiftImage = TRUE;
02476 
02477       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02478 
02479       return TRUE;
02480 }
02481 
02482 void RemoveTextFromButton( INT32 iButtonID )
02483 {
02484       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02485 
02486       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02487       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02488       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02489       Assert( b );
02490       //Init string
02491       if( b->string )
02492             MemFree( b->string );
02493       b->string = NULL;
02494       b->usFont = 0;
02495       b->sForeColor = 0;
02496       b->sWrappedWidth = -1;
02497       b->sShadowColor = -1;
02498       b->sForeColorDown = -1;
02499       b->sShadowColorDown = -1;
02500       b->sForeColorHilited = -1;
02501       b->sShadowColorHilited = -1;
02502       b->bJustification = BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER;
02503       b->bTextXOffset = -1;
02504       b->bTextYOffset = -1;
02505       b->bTextXSubOffSet = 0;
02506       b->bTextYSubOffSet = 0;
02507       b->fShiftText = TRUE;
02508 }
02509 
02510 void RemoveIconFromButton( INT32 iButtonID )
02511 {
02512       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02513 
02514       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02515       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02516       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02517       Assert( b );
02518       //Clear icon
02519       b->iIconID = -1;
02520       b->usIconIndex = -1;
02521       b->bIconXOffset = -1;
02522       b->bIconYOffset = -1;
02523       b->fShiftImage = TRUE;
02524 }
02525 
02526 void AllowDisabledButtonFastHelp( INT32 iButtonID, BOOLEAN fAllow )
02527 {
02528       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02529 
02530       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
02531       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS );
02532       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02533       Assert( b );
02534 
02535       b->Area.uiFlags |= MSYS_ALLOW_DISABLED_FASTHELP;
02536 }

02538 //=============================================================================
02539 //    SetButtonFastHelpText
02540 //
02541 //    Set the text that will be displayed as the FastHelp
02542 //
02543 void SetButtonFastHelpText(INT32 iButton, UINT16 * Text)
02544 {
02545       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02546       if(iButton<0 || iButton>MAX_BUTTONS)
02547             return;
02548       b = ButtonList[iButton];
02549       AssertMsg( b, "Called SetButtonFastHelpText() with a non-existant button." );
02550       SetRegionFastHelpText( &b->Area, Text );
02551 }
