02553 void SetBtnHelpEndCallback( INT32 iButton, MOUSE_HELPTEXT_DONE_CALLBACK CallbackFxn )
02554 {
02555       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02556       if(iButton<0 || iButton>MAX_BUTTONS)
02557             return;
02558       b = ButtonList[iButton];
02559       AssertMsg( b, "Called SetBtnHelpEndCallback() with a non-existant button." );
02560 
02561       SetRegionHelpEndCallback( &b->Area, CallbackFxn );
02562 }
02563 
02564 //=============================================================================
02565 //    QuickButtonCallbackMMove
02566 //
02567 //    Dispatches all button callbacks for mouse movement. This function gets
02568 //    called by the Mouse System. *DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY*
02569 //
02570 void QuickButtonCallbackMMove(MOUSE_REGION *reg,INT32 reason)
02571 {
02572       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02573       INT32 iButtonID;
02574 
02575 
02576       Assert(reg != NULL);
02577 
02578       iButtonID = MSYS_GetRegionUserData(reg,0);
02579 
02580       sprintf( (char *)str, "QuickButtonCallbackMMove: Mouse Region #%d (%d,%d to %d,%d) has invalid buttonID %d",
02581                                     reg->IDNumber, reg->RegionTopLeftX, reg->RegionTopLeftY, reg->RegionBottomRightX, reg->RegionBottomRightY, iButtonID );
02582 
02583       AssertMsg( iButtonID >= 0, str );
02584       AssertMsg( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS, str );
02585 
02586       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02587 
02588       AssertMsg( b != NULL, str );
02589 
02590       if( !b )
02591             return;  //This is getting called when Adding new regions...
02592 
02593 
02594       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED &&
02595               reason & (MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE | MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE) )
02596       {
02597             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02598       }
02599 
02600       // Mouse moved on the button, so reset it's timer to maximum.
02601       if( b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE )
02602       {
02603             //check for sound playing stuff
02604             if( b->ubSoundSchemeID )
02605             {
02606                   if( &b->Area == MSYS_PrevRegion && !gpAnchoredButton )
02607                   {
02608                         if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
02609                         {
02610                               PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_ONTO );
02611                         }
02612                         else
02613                         {
02614                               PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_MOVED_ONTO );
02615                         }
02616                   }
02617             }
02618       }
02619       else
02620       {
02621             //Check if we should play a sound
02622             if( b->ubSoundSchemeID )
02623             {
02624                   if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
02625                   {
02626                         if( &b->Area == MSYS_PrevRegion && !gpAnchoredButton )
02627                         {
02628                               PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_MOVED_OFF_OF );
02629                         }
02630                   }
02631                   else
02632                   {
02633                         PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_MOVED_OFF_OF );
02634                   }
02635             }
02636       }
02637 
02638       // ATE: New stuff for toggle buttons that work with new Win95 paridigm
02639       if ( ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE ) )
02640       {
02641             if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE )
02642             {
02643                   if ( b->ubToggleButtonActivated )
02644                   {
02645                         b->ubToggleButtonActivated = FALSE;
02646 
02647                         if ( !b->ubToggleButtonOldState )
02648                         {
02649                               b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON );
02650                         }
02651                         else
02652                         {
02653                               b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON;
02654                         }
02655                   }
02656             }
02657       }
02658 
02659       // If this button is enabled and there is a callback function associated with it,
02660       // call the callback function.
02661       if((b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED) && (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_MOVE_CALLBACK))
02662             (b->MoveCallback)(b,reason);
02663 }
02664 
02665 
02666 
02667 //=============================================================================
02668 //    QuickButtonCallbackMButn
02669 //
02670 //    Dispatches all button callbacks for button presses. This function is
02671 //    called by the Mouse System. *DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY*
02672 //
02673 void QuickButtonCallbackMButn( MOUSE_REGION *reg, INT32 reason )
02674 {
02675       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02676       INT32       iButtonID;
02677       BOOLEAN MouseBtnDown;
02678       BOOLEAN StateBefore,StateAfter;
02679 
02680 
02681       Assert(reg != NULL);
02682 
02683       iButtonID = MSYS_GetRegionUserData(reg,0);
02684 
02685       sprintf( (char *)str, "QuickButtonCallbackMButn: Mouse Region #%d (%d,%d to %d,%d) has invalid buttonID %d",
02686                                     reg->IDNumber, reg->RegionTopLeftX, reg->RegionTopLeftY, reg->RegionBottomRightX, reg->RegionBottomRightY, iButtonID );
02687 
02688       AssertMsg( iButtonID >= 0, str );
02689       AssertMsg( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS, str );
02690 
02691       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
02692 
02693       AssertMsg( b != NULL, str );
02694 
02695       if( !b )
02696             return;
02697 
02698 
02699       if( reason & (MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN | MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_RBUTTON_DWN) )
02700             MouseBtnDown = TRUE;
02701       else
02702             MouseBtnDown = FALSE;
02703 
02704       StateBefore = (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON) ? (TRUE) : (FALSE);
02705 
02706       // ATE: New stuff for toggle buttons that work with new Win95 paridigm
02707       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_NEWTOGGLE && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
02708       {
02709             if(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
02710             {
02711                   if ( !b->ubToggleButtonActivated )
02712                   {
02713                         if ( !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON ) )
02714                         {
02715                               b->ubToggleButtonOldState = FALSE;
02716                               b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON;
02717                         }
02718                         else
02719                         {
02720                               b->ubToggleButtonOldState = TRUE;
02721                               b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
02722                         }
02723                         b->ubToggleButtonActivated = TRUE;
02724                   }
02725             }
02726             else if (reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP )
02727             {
02728                   b->ubToggleButtonActivated = FALSE;
02729             }
02730       }
02731 
02732 
02733       //Kris:
02734       //Set the anchored button incase the user moves mouse off region while still holding
02735       //down the button, but only if the button is up.  In Win95, buttons that are already
02736       //down, and anchored never change state, unless you release the mouse in the button area.
02737 
02738       if( b->MoveCallback == DEFAULT_MOVE_CALLBACK && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
02739       {
02740             if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
02741             {
02742                   gpAnchoredButton =  b;
02743                   gfAnchoredState = StateBefore;
02744                   b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON;
02745             }
02746             else if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_NO_TOGGLE )
02747             {
02748                   b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
02749             }
02750       }
02751       else if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CHECKBOX )
02752       {
02753             if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
02754             {     //the check box button gets anchored, though it doesn't actually use the anchoring move callback.
02755                   //The effect is different, we don't want to toggle the button state, but we do want to anchor this
02756                   //button so that we don't effect any other buttons while we move the mouse around in anchor mode.
02757                   gpAnchoredButton = b;
02758                   gfAnchoredState = StateBefore;
02759 
02760                   //Trick the before state of the button to be different so the sound will play properly as checkbox buttons 
02761                   //are processed differently.
02762                   StateBefore = (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON) ? FALSE : TRUE;
02763                   StateAfter = !StateBefore;
02764             }
02765             else if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP )
02766             {
02767                   b->uiFlags ^= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON; //toggle the checkbox state upon release inside button area.
02768                   //Trick the before state of the button to be different so the sound will play properly as checkbox buttons 
02769                   //are processed differently.
02770                   StateBefore = (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON) ? FALSE : TRUE;
02771                   StateAfter = !StateBefore;
02772             }
02773       }
02774 
02775       // Should we play a sound if clicked on while disabled?
02776       if( b->ubSoundSchemeID && !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED) && MouseBtnDown )
02777       {
02778             PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_DISABLED_CLICK );
02779       }
02780 
02781       // If this button is disabled, and no callbacks allowed when disabled
02782       // callback
02783       if(!(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED) && !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ALLOW_DISABLED_CALLBACK))
02784             return;
02785 
02786       // Button not enabled but allowed to use callback, then do that!
02787       if(!(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED) && (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ALLOW_DISABLED_CALLBACK))
02788       {
02789             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK )
02790             {
02791                   (b->ClickCallback)(b, reason | BUTTON_DISABLED_CALLBACK );
02792             }
02793             return;
02794       }
02795 
02796       // If there is a callback function with this button, call it
02797       if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICK_CALLBACK)
02798       {
02799             //Kris:  January 6, 1998
02800             //Added these checks to avoid a case where it was possible to process a leftbuttonup message when
02801             //the button wasn't anchored, and should have been.
02802             gfDelayButtonDeletion = TRUE;
02803             if( !(reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP) || b->MoveCallback != DEFAULT_MOVE_CALLBACK ||
02804                         b->MoveCallback == DEFAULT_MOVE_CALLBACK && gpPrevAnchoredButton == b )
02805                   (b->ClickCallback)(b,reason);
02806             gfDelayButtonDeletion = FALSE;
02807       }
02808       else if((reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN) && !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_IGNORE_CLICKS))
02809       {
02810             // Otherwise, do default action with this button.
02811             b->uiFlags^=BUTTON_CLICKED_ON;
02812       }
02813 
02814       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CHECKBOX )
02815       {
02816             StateAfter = (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON) ? (TRUE) : (FALSE);
02817       }
02818 
02819       // Play sounds for this enabled button (disabled sounds have already been done)
02820       if( b->ubSoundSchemeID && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
02821       {
02822             if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_UP )
02823             {
02824                   if( b->ubSoundSchemeID && StateBefore && !StateAfter )
02825                   {
02826                         PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_OFF );
02827                   }
02828             }
02829             else if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LBUTTON_DWN )
02830             {
02831                   if( b->ubSoundSchemeID && !StateBefore && StateAfter)
02832                   {
02833                         PlayButtonSound( iButtonID, BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_ON );
02834                   }
02835             }
02836       }
02837 
02838       if( StateBefore != StateAfter )
02839       {
02840 #ifdef JA2
02841             InvalidateRegion(b->Area.RegionTopLeftX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
02842 #endif
02843       }
02844 
02845       if( gfPendingButtonDeletion )
02846       {
02847             RemoveButtonsMarkedForDeletion();
02848       }
02849 }
02850 
02851 void RenderButtons(void)
02852 {
02853       INT32             iButtonID;
02854       BOOLEAN           fOldButtonDown, fOldEnabled;
02855       GUI_BUTTON *b;
02856 
02857       SaveFontSettings();
02858       for(iButtonID=0;iButtonID<MAX_BUTTONS;iButtonID++)
02859       {
02860             // If the button exists, and it's not owned by another object, draw it
02861             //Kris:  and make sure that the button isn't hidden.
02862             b = ButtonList[iButtonID];
02863             if( b && b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_REGION_ENABLED )
02864             {
02865                   // Check for buttonchanged status
02866                   fOldButtonDown = (BOOLEAN)(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
02867 
02868                   if ( fOldButtonDown != ( b->uiOldFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON ) )
02869                   {
02870                         //Something is different, set dirty!
02871                         b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02872                   }
02873 
02874                   // Check for button dirty flags
02875                   fOldEnabled = (BOOLEAN)(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED);
02876 
02877                   if ( fOldEnabled != ( b->uiOldFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED ) )
02878                   {
02879                         //Something is different, set dirty!
02880                         b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02881                   }
02882 
02883                   // If we ABSOLUTELY want to render every frame....
02884                   if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND )
02885                   {
02886                         b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02887                   }
02888 
02889                   // Set old flags
02890                   b->uiOldFlags = b->uiFlags;
02891 
02892                   if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_FORCE_UNDIRTY )
02893                   {
02894                         b->uiFlags &= ~( BUTTON_DIRTY );
02895                         b->uiFlags &= ~( BUTTON_FORCE_UNDIRTY );
02896                   }
02897 
02898                   // Check if we need to update!
02899                   if ( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_DIRTY )
02900                   {
02901                         // Turn off dirty flag
02902                         b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_DIRTY);
02903                         DrawButtonFromPtr(b);
02904 
02905 #ifdef JA2
02906                         InvalidateRegion(b->Area.RegionTopLeftX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
02907 //#else
02908 //                      InvalidateRegion(b->Area.RegionTopLeftX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY, FALSE);
02909 #endif
02910 
02911                   }
02912             }
02913       }
02914 
02915       // check if we want to render 1 frame later?
02916       if( ( fPausedMarkButtonsDirtyFlag == TRUE ) && ( fDisableHelpTextRestoreFlag == FALSE ) )
02917       {
02918             fPausedMarkButtonsDirtyFlag = FALSE;
02919             MarkButtonsDirty( );
02920       }
02921 
02922       RestoreFontSettings();
02923 }
02924 
02925 //*****************************************************************************
02926 // MarkAButtonDirty
02927 //
02928 void MarkAButtonDirty( INT32 iButtonNum )
02929 {
02930   // surgical dirtying -> marks a user specified button dirty, without dirty the whole lot of them
02931 
02932 
02933   // If the button exists, and it's not owned by another object, draw it
02934             if( ButtonList[ iButtonNum ] )
02935             {
02936                   // Turn on dirty flag
02937                   ButtonList[ iButtonNum ]->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02938             }
02939 
02940 }
02941 
02942 //=============================================================================
02943 //    MarkButtonsDirty
02944 //
02945 void MarkButtonsDirty( void )
02946 {
02947       INT32 x;
02948       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTONS;x++)
02949       {
02950             // If the button exists, and it's not owned by another object, draw it
02951             if( ButtonList[x] )
02952             {
02953                   // Turn on dirty flag
02954                   ButtonList[x]->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
02955             }
02956       }
02957 }
02958 
02959 
02960 void UnMarkButtonDirty( INT32 iButtonIndex )
02961 {
02962   if ( ButtonList[ iButtonIndex ] )
02963   {
02964         ButtonList[ iButtonIndex ]->uiFlags &= ~( BUTTON_DIRTY );
02965   }
02966 }
02967 
02968 void UnmarkButtonsDirty( void )
02969 {
02970       INT32 x;
02971       for(x=0;x<MAX_BUTTONS;x++)
02972       {
02973             // If the button exists, and it's not owned by another object, draw it
02974             if( ButtonList[x] )
02975             {
02976                   UnMarkButtonDirty( x );
02977             }
02978       }
02979 }
02980 
02981 void ForceButtonUnDirty( INT32 iButtonIndex )
02982 {
02983       ButtonList[ iButtonIndex ]->uiFlags &= ~( BUTTON_DIRTY );
02984       ButtonList[ iButtonIndex ]->uiFlags |= BUTTON_FORCE_UNDIRTY;
02985 }
02986 
02987 //=============================================================================
02988 // PauseMarkButtonsDirty
02989 //
02990 
02991 void PausedMarkButtonsDirty( void )
02992 {
02993       // set flag for frame after the next rendering of buttons
02994       fPausedMarkButtonsDirtyFlag = TRUE;
02995 
02996       return;
02997 }
02998 
02999 //=============================================================================
03000 //    DrawButton
03001 //
03002 //    Draws a single button on the screen.
03003 //
03004 BOOLEAN DrawButton(INT32 iButtonID )
03005 {
03006       // Fail if button handle out of range
03007       if( iButtonID < 0 || iButtonID > MAX_BUTTONS )
03008             return FALSE;
03009 
03010       // Fail if button handle is invalid
03011       if( !ButtonList[ iButtonID ] )
03012             return FALSE;
03013 
03014       if( ButtonList[ iButtonID ]->string )
03015             SaveFontSettings();
03016       // Draw this button
03017   if( ButtonList[ iButtonID ]->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_REGION_ENABLED )
03018   {
03019         DrawButtonFromPtr( ButtonList[ iButtonID ] );
03020   }
03021 
03022       if( ButtonList[ iButtonID ]->string )
03023             RestoreFontSettings();
03024       return TRUE;
03025 }
03026 
03027 
03028 
03029 //=============================================================================
03030 //    DrawButtonFromPtr
03031 //
03032 //    Given a pointer to a GUI_BUTTON structure, draws the button on the
03033 //    screen.
03034 //
03035 void DrawButtonFromPtr(GUI_BUTTON *b)
03036 {
03037       Assert( b );
03038       // Draw the appropriate button according to button type
03039       gbDisabledButtonStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_NONE;
03040       switch(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_TYPES)
03041       {
03042             case BUTTON_QUICK:
03043                   DrawQuickButton(b);
03044                   break;
03045             case BUTTON_GENERIC:
03046                   DrawGenericButton(b);
03047                   break;
03048             case BUTTON_HOT_SPOT:
03049                   if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_NO_TOGGLE)
03050                         b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON);
03051                   return;  //hotspots don't have text, but if you want to, change this to a break!
03052             case BUTTON_CHECKBOX:
03053                   DrawCheckBoxButton(b);
03054                   break;
03055       }
03056       //If button has an icon, overlay it on current button.
03057       if( b->iIconID != -1 )
03058             DrawIconOnButton( b );
03059       //If button has text, draw it now
03060       if( b->string )
03061             DrawTextOnButton( b );
03062       //If the button is disabled, and a style has been calculated, then
03063       //draw the style last.
03064       switch( gbDisabledButtonStyle )
03065       {
03066             case DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED:
03067                   DrawHatchOnButton( b );
03068                   break;
03069             case DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED:
03070                   DrawShadeOnButton( b );
03071                   break;
03072       }
03073       if( b->bDefaultStatus )
03074       {
03075             DrawDefaultOnButton( b );
03076       }
03077 }
03078 
03079 //=============================================================================
03080 //    DrawQuickButton
03081 //
03082 //    Draws a QuickButton type button on the screen.
03083 //
03084 void DrawQuickButton(GUI_BUTTON *b)
03085 {
03086       INT32 UseImage;
03087       UseImage=0;
03088       // Is button Enabled, or diabled but no "Grayed" image associated with this QuickButton?
03089       if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
03090       {
03091             // Is the button's state ON?
03092             if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON)
03093             {
03094                   // Is the mouse over this area, and we have a hilite image?
03095                   if((b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA) && gfRenderHilights &&
03096                               (ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnHilite != -1))
03097                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnHilite;                  // Use On-Hilite image
03098                   else if(ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnNormal != -1)
03099                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnNormal;                  // Use On-Normal image
03100             }
03101             else
03102             {
03103                   // Is the mouse over the button, and do we have hilite image?
03104                   if((b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA) && gfRenderHilights &&
03105                               (ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffHilite != -1))
03106                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffHilite;                 // Use Off-Hilite image
03107                   else if(ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffNormal != -1)
03108                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffNormal;                 // Use Off-Normal image
03109             }
03110       }
03111       else if( ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].Grayed != -1)
03112       {     // Button is diabled so use the "Grayed-out" image
03113             UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].Grayed;
03114       }
03115       else
03116       {
03117             UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffNormal;
03118             switch( b->bDisabledStyle )
03119             {
03120                   case DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT:
03121                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = b->string ? DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED : DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED;
03122                         break;
03123                   case DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED:
03124                   case DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED:
03125                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = b->bDisabledStyle;
03126                         break;
03127             }
03128       }
03129 
03130       // Display the button image
03131       BltVideoObject(ButtonDestBuffer, ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].vobj,
03132                                                  (UINT16)UseImage, b->XLoc, b->YLoc,
03133                                                  VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY, NULL);
03134 }
03135 
03136 void DrawHatchOnButton( GUI_BUTTON *b )
03137 {
03138       UINT8  *pDestBuf;
03139       UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES;
03140       SGPRect ClipRect;
03141       ClipRect.iLeft = b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
03142       ClipRect.iRight = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - 1;
03143       ClipRect.iTop = b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
03144       ClipRect.iBottom = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - 1;
03145       pDestBuf = LockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer, &uiDestPitchBYTES );
03146       Blt16BPPBufferHatchRect( (UINT16*)pDestBuf, uiDestPitchBYTES, &ClipRect );
03147       UnLockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer );
03148 }
03149 
03150 void DrawShadeOnButton( GUI_BUTTON *b )
03151 {
03152       UINT8 *pDestBuf;
03153       UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES;
03154       SGPRect ClipRect;
03155       ClipRect.iLeft = b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
03156       ClipRect.iRight = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX-1;
03157       ClipRect.iTop = b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
03158       ClipRect.iBottom = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY-1;
03159       pDestBuf = LockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer, &uiDestPitchBYTES );
03160       Blt16BPPBufferShadowRect( (UINT16*)pDestBuf, uiDestPitchBYTES, &ClipRect );
03161       UnLockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer );
03162 }
03163 
03164 void DrawDefaultOnButton( GUI_BUTTON *b )
03165 {
03166       UINT8 *pDestBuf;
03167       UINT32 uiDestPitchBYTES;
03168       pDestBuf = LockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer, &uiDestPitchBYTES );
03169       SetClippingRegionAndImageWidth( uiDestPitchBYTES, 0, 0, SCREEN_WIDTH, SCREEN_HEIGHT );
03170       if( b->bDefaultStatus == DEFAULT_STATUS_DARKBORDER || b->bDefaultStatus == DEFAULT_STATUS_WINDOWS95 )
03171       { 
03172             //left (one thick)
03173             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1, 0, pDestBuf );
03174             //top (one thick)
03175             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, 0, pDestBuf );
03176             //right (two thick)
03177             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1, 0, pDestBuf );
03178             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1, 0, pDestBuf );
03179             //bottom (two thick)
03180             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY, 0, pDestBuf );
03181             LineDraw( TRUE, b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1, 0, pDestBuf );
03182             #ifdef JA2
03183             InvalidateRegion( b->Area.RegionTopLeftX-1, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY-1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX+1, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY+1 );
03184             #endif
03185       }
03186       if( b->bDefaultStatus == DEFAULT_STATUS_DOTTEDINTERIOR || b->bDefaultStatus == DEFAULT_STATUS_WINDOWS95 )
03187       { //Draw an internal dotted rectangle.
03188 
03189       }
03190       UnLockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer );
03191 }
03192 
03193 void DrawCheckBoxButtonOn( INT32 iButtonID )
03194 {
03195       GUI_BUTTON *b;
03196       BOOLEAN fLeftButtonState = gfLeftButtonState;
03197 
03198       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
03199       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
03200       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
03201       Assert( b );
03202 
03203       gfLeftButtonState = TRUE;
03204       b->Area.uiFlags |= MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA;
03205 
03206       DrawButton( iButtonID );
03207 
03208       gfLeftButtonState = fLeftButtonState;
03209 }
03210 
03211 void DrawCheckBoxButtonOff( INT32 iButtonID )
03212 {
03213       GUI_BUTTON *b;
03214       BOOLEAN fLeftButtonState = gfLeftButtonState;
03215 
03216       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
03217       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
03218       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
03219       Assert( b );
03220 
03221       gfLeftButtonState = FALSE;
03222       b->Area.uiFlags |= MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA;
03223 
03224       DrawButton( iButtonID );
03225 
03226       gfLeftButtonState = fLeftButtonState;
03227 }
03228 
03229 
03230 void DrawCheckBoxButton( GUI_BUTTON *b )
03231 {
03232       INT32 UseImage;
03233 
03234       UseImage=0;
03235       // Is button Enabled, or diabled but no "Grayed" image associated with this QuickButton?
03236       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
03237       {
03238             // Is the button's state ON?
03239             if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON)
03240             {
03241                   // Is the mouse over this area, and we have a hilite image?
03242                   if( b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA && gfRenderHilights &&
03243                               gfLeftButtonState &&
03244                               ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnHilite != -1 )
03245                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnHilite;                  // Use On-Hilite image
03246                   else if(ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnNormal != -1)
03247                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnNormal;                  // Use On-Normal image
03248             }
03249             else
03250             {
03251                   // Is the mouse over the button, and do we have hilite image?
03252                   if( b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA && gfRenderHilights &&
03253                           gfLeftButtonState &&
03254                               ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffHilite != -1 )
03255                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffHilite;                 // Use Off-Hilite image
03256                   else if(ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffNormal != -1)
03257                         UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffNormal;                 // Use Off-Normal image
03258             }
03259       }
03260       else if( ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].Grayed != -1 )
03261       {     // Button is disabled so use the "Grayed-out" image
03262             UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].Grayed;
03263       }
03264       else //use the disabled style
03265       {
03266             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON )
03267                   UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OnHilite;
03268             else
03269                   UseImage = ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].OffHilite;
03270             switch( b->bDisabledStyle )
03271             {
03272                   case DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT:
03273                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED;
03274                         break;
03275                   case DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED:
03276                   case DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED:
03277                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = b->bDisabledStyle;
03278                         break;
03279             }
03280       }
03281 
03282       // Display the button image
03283       BltVideoObject(ButtonDestBuffer, ButtonPictures[b->ImageNum].vobj,
03284                                                  (UINT16)UseImage, b->XLoc, b->YLoc,
03285                                                  VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY, NULL);
03286 }
03287 
03288 void DrawIconOnButton(GUI_BUTTON *b)
03289 {
03290       INT32 xp,yp,width,height,IconX,IconY;
03291       INT32 IconW,IconH;
03292       SGPRect NewClip,OldClip;
03293       ETRLEObject       *pTrav;
03294       HVOBJECT    hvObject;
03295 
03296       // If there's an actual icon on this button, try to show it.
03297       if(b->iIconID >= 0)
03298       {
03299             // Get width and height of button area
03300             width = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
03301             height = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
03302 
03303             // Compute viewable area (inside borders)
03304             NewClip.iLeft = b->XLoc + 3;
03305             NewClip.iRight = b->XLoc + width - 3;
03306             NewClip.iTop = b->YLoc + 2;
03307             NewClip.iBottom = b->YLoc + height - 2;
03308 
03309             // Get Icon's blit start coordinates
03310             IconX = NewClip.iLeft;
03311             IconY = NewClip.iTop;
03312 
03313             // Get current clip area
03314             GetClippingRect(&OldClip);
03315 
03316             // Clip button's viewable area coords to screen
03317             if(NewClip.iLeft < OldClip.iLeft)
03318                   NewClip.iLeft = OldClip.iLeft;
03319 
03320             // Is button right off the right side of the screen?
03321             if(NewClip.iLeft > OldClip.iRight)
03322                   return;
03323 
03324             if(NewClip.iRight > OldClip.iRight)
03325                   NewClip.iRight = OldClip.iRight;
03326 
03327             // Is button completely off the left side of the screen?
03328             if(NewClip.iRight < OldClip.iLeft)
03329                   return;
03330 
03331             if(NewClip.iTop < OldClip.iTop)
03332                   NewClip.iTop = OldClip.iTop;
03333 
03334             // Are we right off the bottom of the screen?
03335             if(NewClip.iTop > OldClip.iBottom)
03336                   return;
03337 
03338             if(NewClip.iBottom > OldClip.iBottom)
03339                   NewClip.iBottom = OldClip.iBottom;
03340 
03341             // Are we off the top?
03342             if(NewClip.iBottom < OldClip.iTop)
03343                   return;
03344 
03345             // Did we clip the viewable area out of existance?
03346             if((NewClip.iRight <= NewClip.iLeft) || (NewClip.iBottom <= NewClip.iTop))
03347                   return;
03348 
03349             // Get the width and height of the icon itself
03350             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_GENERIC )
03351                   pTrav = &(GenericButtonIcons[b->iIconID]->pETRLEObject[b->usIconIndex]);
03352             else
03353             {
03354                   GetVideoObject( &hvObject, b->iIconID );
03355                   pTrav = &(hvObject->pETRLEObject[b->usIconIndex] );
03356             }
03357             IconH = (UINT32)(pTrav->usHeight+pTrav->sOffsetY);
03358             IconW = (UINT32)(pTrav->usWidth+pTrav->sOffsetX);
03359 
03360             // Compute coordinates for centering the icon on the button or
03361             // use the offset system.
03362             if( b->bIconXOffset == -1 )
03363                   xp = (((width-6)-IconW) / 2) + IconX;
03364             else
03365                   xp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftX + b->bIconXOffset;
03366             if( b->bIconYOffset == -1 )
03367                   yp = (((height-4)-IconH) / 2) + IconY;
03368             else
03369                   yp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftY + b->bIconYOffset;
03370 
03371             // Was the button clicked on? if so, move the image slightly for the illusion
03372             // that the image moved into the screen.
03373             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON && b->fShiftImage )
03374             {
03375                   xp++;
03376                   yp++;
03377             }
03378 
03379             // Set the clipping rectangle to the viewable area of the button
03380             SetClippingRect(&NewClip);
03381             // Blit the icon
03382             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_GENERIC )
03383                   BltVideoObject( ButtonDestBuffer,GenericButtonIcons[b->iIconID], b->usIconIndex, (INT16)xp, (INT16)yp,
03384                                                               VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY, NULL);
03385             else
03386                   BltVideoObject( ButtonDestBuffer, hvObject, b->usIconIndex, (INT16)xp, (INT16)yp,
03387                                       VO_BLT_SRCTRANSPARENCY, NULL );
03388             // Restore previous clip region
03389             SetClippingRect(&OldClip);
03390       }
03391 }
03392 
03393 
03394 //If a button has text attached to it, then it'll draw it last.
03395 void DrawTextOnButton(GUI_BUTTON *b)
03396 {
03397       INT32 xp,yp,width,height,TextX,TextY;
03398       SGPRect NewClip,OldClip;
03399       INT16 sForeColor;
03400 
03401       // If this button actually has a string to print
03402       if( b->string )
03403       {
03404             // Get the width and height of this button
03405             width = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
03406             height = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
03407 
03408             // Compute the viewable area on this button
03409             NewClip.iLeft = b->XLoc + 3;
03410             NewClip.iRight = b->XLoc + width - 3;
03411             NewClip.iTop = b->YLoc + 2;
03412             NewClip.iBottom = b->YLoc + height - 2;
03413 
03414             // Get the starting coordinates to print
03415             TextX = NewClip.iLeft;
03416             TextY = NewClip.iTop;
03417 
03418             // Get the current clipping area
03419             GetClippingRect(&OldClip);
03420 
03421             // Clip the button's viewable area to the screen
03422             if(NewClip.iLeft < OldClip.iLeft)
03423                   NewClip.iLeft = OldClip.iLeft;
03424 
03425             // Are we off hte right side?
03426             if(NewClip.iLeft > OldClip.iRight)
03427                   return;
03428 
03429             if(NewClip.iRight > OldClip.iRight)
03430                   NewClip.iRight = OldClip.iRight;
03431 
03432             // Are we off the left side?
03433             if(NewClip.iRight < OldClip.iLeft)
03434                   return;
03435 
03436             if(NewClip.iTop < OldClip.iTop)
03437                   NewClip.iTop = OldClip.iTop;
03438 
03439             // Are we off the bottom of the screen?
03440             if(NewClip.iTop > OldClip.iBottom)
03441                   return;
03442 
03443             if(NewClip.iBottom > OldClip.iBottom)
03444                   NewClip.iBottom = OldClip.iBottom;
03445 
03446             // Are we off the top?
03447             if(NewClip.iBottom < OldClip.iTop)
03448                   return;
03449 
03450             // Did we clip the viewable area out of existance?
03451             if((NewClip.iRight <= NewClip.iLeft) || (NewClip.iBottom <= NewClip.iTop))
03452                   return;
03453 
03454             // Set the font printing settings to the buttons viewable area
03455             SetFontDestBuffer(ButtonDestBuffer, NewClip.iLeft,
03456                                                                   NewClip.iTop, NewClip.iRight,
03457                                                                   NewClip.iBottom, FALSE);
03458 
03459             // Compute the coordinates to center the text
03460             if( b->bTextYOffset == -1 )
03461                   yp = (((height) - GetFontHeight(b->usFont)) / 2) + TextY - 1;
03462             else
03463                   yp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftY + b->bTextYOffset;
03464             if( b->bTextXOffset == -1 )
03465             {
03466                   switch( b->bJustification )
03467                   {
03468                         case BUTTON_TEXT_LEFT:
03469                               xp = TextX + 3;
03470                               break;
03471                         case BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT:
03472                               xp = NewClip.iRight - StringPixLength(b->string, b->usFont) - 3;
03473                               break;
03474                         case BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER:
03475                         default:
03476                               xp = (((width-6)-StringPixLength(b->string,b->usFont)) / 2) + TextX;
03477                               break;
03478                   }
03479             }
03480             else
03481                   xp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftX + b->bTextXOffset;
03482 
03483             // Set the printing font to the button text font
03484             SetFont(b->usFont);
03485 
03486             // print the text
03487             SetFontBackground( FONT_MCOLOR_BLACK );
03488             SetFontForeground( (UINT8)b->sForeColor );
03489             sForeColor = b->sForeColor;
03490             if( b->sShadowColor != -1 )
03491                   SetFontShadow( (UINT8)b->sShadowColor );
03492             //Override the colors if necessary.
03493             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED && b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA && b->sForeColorHilited != -1 )
03494             {
03495                   SetFontForeground( (UINT8)b->sForeColorHilited );
03496                   sForeColor = b->sForeColorHilited;
03497             }
03498             else if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON && b->sForeColorDown != -1 )
03499             {
03500                   SetFontForeground( (UINT8)b->sForeColorDown );
03501                   sForeColor = b->sForeColorDown;
03502             }
03503             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED && b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA && b->sShadowColorHilited != -1 )
03504             {
03505                   SetFontShadow( (UINT8)b->sShadowColorHilited );
03506             }
03507             else if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON && b->sShadowColorDown != -1 )
03508             {
03509                   SetFontShadow( (UINT8)b->sShadowColorDown );
03510             }
03511             if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON && b->fShiftText )
03512             {     // Was the button clicked on? if so, move the text slightly for the illusion
03513                   // that the text moved into the screen.
03514                   xp++;
03515                   yp++;
03516             }
03517 #ifdef JA2
03518             if( b->sWrappedWidth != -1 )
03519             {
03520                   UINT8 bJustified=0;
03521                   switch( b->bJustification )
03522                   {
03523                         case BUTTON_TEXT_LEFT:        bJustified = LEFT_JUSTIFIED;        break;
03524                         case BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT:       bJustified = RIGHT_JUSTIFIED;       break;
03525                         case BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER:      bJustified = CENTER_JUSTIFIED;      break;
03526                         default:                                                    Assert( 0 );                                                            break;
03527                   }
03528                   if( b->bTextXOffset == -1 )
03529                   {
03530                         //Kris:
03531                         //There needs to be recalculation of the start positions based on the
03532                         //justification and the width specified wrapped width.  I was drawing a
03533                         //double lined word on the right side of the button to find it drawing way
03534                         //over to the left.  I've added the necessary code for the right and center
03535                         //justification.
03536                         yp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftY + 2;
03537                         
03538                         switch( b->bJustification )
03539                         {
03540                               case BUTTON_TEXT_RIGHT:
03541                                     xp = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - 3 - b->sWrappedWidth;
03542                               
03543                                     if( b->fShiftText && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON )
03544                                           xp++, yp++;
03545                                     break;
03546                               case BUTTON_TEXT_CENTER:
03547                                     xp = b->Area.RegionTopLeftX + 3 + b->sWrappedWidth/2;
03548                                     
03549                                     if( b->fShiftText && b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON )
03550                                           xp++, yp++;
03551                                     break;
03552                         }
03553                   }
03554                   yp+= b->bTextYSubOffSet;
03555                   xp+= b->bTextXSubOffSet;
03556                   DisplayWrappedString((UINT16)xp, (UINT16)yp, b->sWrappedWidth, 1, b->usFont, (UINT8)sForeColor, b->string, FONT_MCOLOR_BLACK, FALSE, bJustified);
03557             }
03558             else
03559             {
03560                   yp+= b->bTextYSubOffSet;
03561                   xp+= b->bTextXSubOffSet;
03562                   mprintf(xp, yp, b->string);
03563             }
03564 #else
03565             if(b->fMultiColor)
03566                   gprintf(xp, yp, b->string);
03567             else
03568                   mprintf(xp, yp, b->string);
03569 #endif
03570             // Restore the old text printing settings
03571       }
03572 }
03573 
03574 
03575 
03576 //=============================================================================
03577 //    DrawGenericButton
03578 //
03579 //    This function is called by the DrawIconicButton and DrawTextButton
03580 //    routines to draw the borders and background of the buttons.
03581 //
03582 void DrawGenericButton(GUI_BUTTON *b)
03583 {
03584       INT32 NumChunksWide,NumChunksHigh,cx,cy,width,height,hremain,wremain;
03585       INT32 q,ImgNum,ox,oy;
03586       INT32 iBorderHeight, iBorderWidth;
03587       HVOBJECT BPic;
03588       UINT32                  uiDestPitchBYTES;
03589       UINT8                   *pDestBuf;
03590       SGPRect                 ClipRect;
03591       ETRLEObject *pTrav;
03592 
03593       // Select the graphics to use depending on the current state of the button
03594       if( b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED )
03595       {
03596             if ( !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_ENABLED) && (GenericButtonGrayed[b->ImageNum]==NULL) )
03597                   BPic = GenericButtonOffNormal[b->ImageNum];
03598             else if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON)
03599             {
03600                   if((b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA) && (GenericButtonOnHilite[b->ImageNum]!=NULL) && gfRenderHilights )
03601                         BPic = GenericButtonOnHilite[b->ImageNum];
03602                   else
03603                         BPic = GenericButtonOnNormal[b->ImageNum];
03604             }
03605             else
03606             {
03607                   if((b->Area.uiFlags & MSYS_MOUSE_IN_AREA) && (GenericButtonOffHilite[b->ImageNum]!=NULL) && gfRenderHilights )
03608                         BPic = GenericButtonOffHilite[b->ImageNum];
03609                   else
03610                         BPic = GenericButtonOffNormal[b->ImageNum];
03611             }
03612       }
03613       else if( GenericButtonGrayed[ b->ImageNum ] )
03614             BPic = GenericButtonGrayed[b->ImageNum];
03615       else
03616       {
03617             BPic = GenericButtonOffNormal[ b->ImageNum ];
03618             switch( b->bDisabledStyle )
03619             {
03620                   case DISABLED_STYLE_DEFAULT:
03621                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = b->string ? DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED : DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED;
03622                         break;
03623                   case DISABLED_STYLE_HATCHED:
03624                   case DISABLED_STYLE_SHADED:
03625                         gbDisabledButtonStyle = b->bDisabledStyle;
03626                         break;
03627             }
03628       }
03629 
03630       iBorderWidth=3;
03631       iBorderHeight=2;
03632       pTrav=NULL;
03633 
03634 // DB - Added this to support more flexible sizing of border images
03635 // The 3x2 size was a bit limiting. JA2 should default to the original
03636 // size, unchanged
03637 
03638 #ifndef JA2
03639       pTrav = &(BPic->pETRLEObject[0] );
03640       iBorderHeight = (INT32)pTrav->usHeight;
03641       iBorderWidth = (INT32)pTrav->usWidth;
03642 #endif
03643 
03644       // Compute the number of button "chunks" needed to be blitted
03645       width = b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
03646       height = b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
03647       NumChunksWide = width / iBorderWidth;
03648       NumChunksHigh = height / iBorderHeight;
03649       hremain = height % iBorderHeight;
03650       wremain = width % iBorderWidth;
03651 
03652       cx = (b->XLoc + ((NumChunksWide-1)*iBorderWidth) + wremain);
03653       cy = (b->YLoc + ((NumChunksHigh-1)*iBorderHeight) + hremain);
03654 
03655       // Fill the button's area with the button's background color
03656       ColorFillVideoSurfaceArea(ButtonDestBuffer,b->Area.RegionTopLeftX,
03657                                                                                                                                      b->Area.RegionTopLeftY,
03658                                                                                                                                      b->Area.RegionBottomRightX,
03659                                                                                                                                      b->Area.RegionBottomRightY,
03660                                                                                                                                      GenericButtonFillColors[b->ImageNum]);
03661 
03662       // If there is a background image, fill the button's area with it
03663       if(GenericButtonBackground[b->ImageNum]!=NULL)
03664       {
03665             ox=oy=0;
03666             // if the button was clicked on, adjust the background image so that we get
03667             // the illusion that it is sunk into the screen.
03668             if(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_CLICKED_ON)
03669                   ox=oy=1;
03670 
03671             // Fill the area with the image, tilling it if need be.
03672             ImageFillVideoSurfaceArea(ButtonDestBuffer,b->Area.RegionTopLeftX+ox,
03673                                                                                                                                            b->Area.RegionTopLeftY+oy,
03674                                                                                                                                            b->Area.RegionBottomRightX,
03675                                                                                                                                            b->Area.RegionBottomRightY,
03676                                                                                                                                            GenericButtonBackground[b->ImageNum],
03677                                                                                                                                            GenericButtonBackgroundIndex[b->ImageNum],
03678                                                                                                                                            GenericButtonOffsetX[b->ImageNum],
03679                                                                                                                                            GenericButtonOffsetY[b->ImageNum]);
03680       }
03681 
03682       // Lock the dest buffer
03683       pDestBuf = LockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer, &uiDestPitchBYTES );
03684 
03685       GetClippingRect(&ClipRect);
03686 
03687       // Draw the button's borders and corners (horizontally)
03688       for(q=0;q<NumChunksWide;q++)
03689       {
03690             if(q==0)
03691                   ImgNum=0;
03692             else
03693                   ImgNum=1;
03694 
03695             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03696             {
03697                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03698                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03699                                                                   (INT32)(b->XLoc + (q*iBorderWidth)),
03700                                                                   (INT32)b->YLoc,
03701                                                                   (UINT16)ImgNum, &ClipRect );
03702             }
03703             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03704             {
03705                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03706                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03707                                                                   (INT32)(b->XLoc + (q*iBorderWidth)),
03708                                                                   (INT32)b->YLoc,
03709                                                                   (UINT16)ImgNum, &ClipRect );
03710             }
03711 
03712             if(q==0)
03713                   ImgNum=5;
03714             else
03715                   ImgNum=6;
03716 
03717             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03718             {
03719                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03720                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03721                                                                   (INT32)(b->XLoc + (q*iBorderWidth)),
03722                                                                   cy, (UINT16)ImgNum, &ClipRect );
03723             }
03724             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03725             {
03726                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip((UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03727                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03728                                                                   (INT32)(b->XLoc + (q*iBorderWidth)),
03729                                                                   cy, (UINT16)ImgNum, &ClipRect );
03730             }
03731 
03732       }
03733       // Blit the right side corners
03734             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03735             {
03736                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03737                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03738                                                                   cx, (INT32)b->YLoc,
03739                                                                   2, &ClipRect );
03740             }
03741             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03742             {
03743                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03744                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03745                                                                   cx, (INT32)b->YLoc,
03746                                                                   2, &ClipRect );
03747             }
03748 
03749 
03750             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03751             {
03752                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03753                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03754                                                                   cx, cy, 7, &ClipRect );
03755             }
03756             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03757             {
03758                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03759                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03760                                                                   cx, cy, 7, &ClipRect );
03761             }
03762       // Draw the vertical members of the button's borders
03763       NumChunksHigh--;
03764 
03765       if(hremain!=0)
03766       {
03767             q=NumChunksHigh;
03768             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03769             {
03770                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03771                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03772                                                                   (INT32)b->XLoc,
03773                                                                   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight) - (iBorderHeight-hremain)),
03774                                                                   3, &ClipRect );
03775             }
03776             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03777             {
03778                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03779                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03780                                                                   (INT32)b->XLoc,
03781                                                                   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight) - (iBorderHeight-hremain)),
03782                                                                   3, &ClipRect );
03783             }
03784 
03785             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03786             {
03787                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03788                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03789                                                                   cx,   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight) - (iBorderHeight-hremain)),
03790                                                                   4, &ClipRect );
03791             }
03792             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03793             {
03794                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip((UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03795                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03796                                                                   cx,   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight) - (iBorderHeight-hremain)),
03797                                                                   4, &ClipRect );
03798             }
03799       }
03800 
03801       for(q=1;q<NumChunksHigh;q++)
03802       {
03803             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03804             {
03805                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03806                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03807                                                                   (INT32)b->XLoc,
03808                                                                   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight)),
03809                                                                   3, &ClipRect );
03810             }
03811             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03812             {
03813                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip((UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03814                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03815                                                                   (INT32)b->XLoc,
03816                                                                   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight)),
03817                                                                   3, &ClipRect );
03818             }
03819 
03820             if(gbPixelDepth==16)
03821             {
03822                   Blt8BPPDataTo16BPPBufferTransparentClip( (UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03823                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03824                                                                   cx,   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight)),
03825                                                                   4, &ClipRect );
03826             }
03827             else if(gbPixelDepth==8)
03828             {
03829                   Blt8BPPDataTo8BPPBufferTransparentClip((UINT16*)pDestBuf,
03830                                                                   uiDestPitchBYTES, BPic,
03831                                                                   cx,   (INT32)(b->YLoc + (q*iBorderHeight)),
03832                                                                   4, &ClipRect );
03833             }
03834       }
03835 
03836       // Unlock buffer
03837       UnLockVideoSurface( ButtonDestBuffer );
03838 
03839 }

03860 typedef struct _CreateDlgInfo {
03861       INT32             iFlags;                                   // Holds the creation flags
03862 
03863       INT32             iPosX;                                    // Screen position of dialog box
03864       INT32             iPosY;
03865       INT32             iWidth;                                   // Dimensions of dialog box (if needed)
03866       INT32             iHeight;
03867 
03868       INT32             iAreaWidth;                   // Dimensions of area the dialog box will be
03869       INT32             iAreaHeight;                  // placed (for auto-sizing and auto-placement
03870       INT32             iAreaOffsetX;                 // only)
03871       INT32             iAreaOffsetY;
03872 
03873       UINT16            *zDlgText;                    // Text to be displayed (if any)
03874       INT32             iTextFont;                    // Font to be used for text (if any)
03875       UINT16            usTextCols;                   // Font colors (for mono fonts only)
03876 
03877       INT32             iTextAreaX;                   // Area in dialog box where text is to be
03878       INT32             iTextAreaY;                   // put (for non-auto placed text)
03879       INT32             iTextAreaWidth;
03880       INT32             iTextAreaHeight;
03881 
03882       HVOBJECT    hBackImg;                           // Background pic for dialog box (if any)
03883       INT32             iBackImgIndex;          // Sub-image index to use for image
03884       INT32             iBackOffsetX;                 // Offset on dialog box where to put image
03885       INT32             iBackOffsetY;
03886 
03887       HVOBJECT    hIconImg;                           // Icon image pic and index.
03888       INT32             iIconImgIndex;
03889       INT32             iIconPosX;
03890       INT32             iIconPosY;
03891 
03892       INT32             iBtnTypes;
03893 
03894       INT32             iOkPosX;                            // Ok button info
03895       INT32             iOkPosY;
03896       INT32             iOkWidth;
03897       INT32             iOkHeight;
03898       INT32             iOkImg;
03899 
03900       INT32             iCnclPosX;                    // Cancel button info
03901       INT32             iCnclPosY;
03902       INT32             iCnclWidth;
03903       INT32             iCnclHeight;
03904       INT32             iCnclImg;
03905 } CreateDlgInfo;
03906 
03907 #define DLG_RESTRICT_MOUSE                      1
03908 #define DLG_OK_BUTTON                                       2
03909 #define DLG_CANCEL_BUTTON                             4
03910 #define DLG_AUTOSIZE                                        8
03911 #define DLG_RECREATE                                        16
03912 #define DLG_AUTOPOSITION                              32
03913 #define DLG_TEXT_IN_AREA                              64
03914 #define DLG_USE_BKGRND_IMAGE              128
03915 #define DLG_USE_BORDERS                               256
03916 #define DLG_USE_BTN_HOTSPOTS              512
03917 #define DLG_USE_MONO_FONTS                      1024
03918 #define DLG_IS_ACTIVE                                       2048
03919 
03920 #define DLG_MANUAL_RENDER                             0
03921 #define DLG_START_RENDER                              1
03922 #define DLG_STOP_RENDER                               2
03923 #define DLG_AUTO_RENDER                               3

03929 #define DLG_STATUS_OK                                       1
03930 #define DLG_STATUS_CANCEL                             2
03931 #define DLG_STATUS_PENDING                      3
03932

03934 #define DLG_POSITION                                        1
03935 #define DLG_AREA                                                  2
03936 #define DLG_TEXT                                                  3
03937 #define DLG_TEXTAREA                                        4
03938 #define DLG_BACKPIC                                               5
03939 #define DLG_ICON                                                  6
03940 #define DLG_OKBUTTON                                        7
03941 #define DLG_CANCELBUTTON                              8
03942 #define DLG_OPTIONS                                               9
03943 #define DLG_SIZE                                                  10

03945 
03946 BOOLEAN SetDialogAttributes( CreateDlgInfo *pDlgInfo, INT32 iAttrib, ... )
03947 {
03948       va_list arg;
03949       INT32 iFont,iFontOptions;
03950       UINT16 *zString;
03951       INT32 iX,iY,iW,iH;
03952       INT32 iIndex;
03953       HVOBJECT hVObj;
03954       INT32 iButnImg;
03955       INT32 iFlags;
03956       UINT8 ubFGrnd,ubBGrnd;
03957 
03958       // Set up for var args
03959       va_start( arg, iAttrib );           // Init variable argument list
03960 
03961       switch (iAttrib)
03962       {
03963             case DLG_CLEARALL:
03964                   // Check to make sure it's not enabled, if so either abort or trash it!
03965                   memset( pDlgInfo, 0, sizeof(CreateDlgInfo) );
03966                   break;
03967 
03968             case DLG_POSITION:
03969                   // Screen X/Y position of dialog box
03970                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03971                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03972                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03973 
03974                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03975                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03976                   break;
03977 
03978             case DLG_SIZE:
03979                   // Width and height of doalog box
03980                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03981                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03982                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03983                   break;
03984 
03985             case DLG_AREA:
03986                   // Area where dialog box should be placed in (if not screen)
03987                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03988                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03989                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03990                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03991                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03992                   break;
03993 
03994             case DLG_TEXT:
03995                   // Set text and font for this dialog box
03996                   iFontOptions = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03997 
03998                   iFont = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
03999                   pDlgInfo->iTextFont = iFont;
04000 
04001                   zString = (UINT16 *)va_arg( arg, UINT32 );
04002 
04003                   if ( pDlgInfo->zDlgText != NULL )
04004                         MemFree( pDlgInfo->zDlgText );
04005 
04006                   if ( zString == NULL )
04007                         pDlgInfo->zDlgText = NULL;
04008                   else
04009                   {
04010                         pDlgInfo->zDlgText = NULL;    // Temp
04011                   }
04012 
04013                   if ( iFontOptions & DLG_USE_MONO_FONTS )
04014                   {
04015                         ubFGrnd = va_arg( arg, UINT8 );
04016                         ubBGrnd = va_arg( arg, UINT8 );
04017                         pDlgInfo->usTextCols = ((((UINT16)ubBGrnd)<<8) | (UINT16)ubFGrnd);
04018                   }
04019                   break;
04020 
04021             case DLG_TEXTAREA:
04022                   // Area on dialog box where the text should go!
04023                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04024                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04025                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04026                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04027                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04028                   break;
04029 
04030             case DLG_BACKPIC:
04031                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04032                   hVObj = (HVOBJECT)va_arg( arg, UINT32 );
04033                   iIndex = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04034                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04035                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04036                   break;
04037 
04038             case DLG_ICON:
04039                   // Icon
04040                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04041                   hVObj = (HVOBJECT)va_arg( arg, UINT32 );
04042                   iIndex = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04043                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04044                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04045                   break;
04046 
04047             case DLG_OKBUTTON:
04048                   // Ok button options
04049                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04050                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04051                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04052                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04053                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04054                   iButnImg = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04055                   break;
04056 
04057             case DLG_CANCELBUTTON:
04058                   // Cancel button options
04059                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04060                   iX = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04061                   iY = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04062                   iW = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04063                   iH = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04064                   iButnImg = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04065                   break;
04066 
04067             case DLG_OPTIONS:
04068                   iFlags = va_arg( arg, INT32 );
04069                   break;
04070       }
04071 
04072       va_end( arg ); // Must have this for proper exit
04073 
04074       return(TRUE);
04075 }

04078 {
04079       return (-1);
04080 }

04093 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
04094 
04095 // template INT32 CreateCheckBoxButton<char const *>(INT16, INT16, char *, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK);
04096 template INT32 CreateCheckBoxButton<char const *>(INT16, INT16, char const *, INT16, GUI_CALLBACK);
04097 template <typename string3>
04098 INT32 CreateCheckBoxButton( INT16 x, INT16 y, string3 filename, INT16 Priority, GUI_CALLBACK ClickCallback )
04099 {
04100       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04101       INT32 ButPic, iButtonID;
04102       Assert( filename != NULL );
04103       Assert( strlen(filename) );
04104       if( ( ButPic = LoadButtonImage(filename,-1,0,1,2,3) ) == -1 )
04105       {
04106             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateCheckBoxButton: Can't load button image");
04107             return( -1 );
04108       }
04109       iButtonID = (INT16)QuickCreateButton(
04110                                                       (UINT32)ButPic, x, y, BUTTON_CHECKBOX, Priority,
04111                                                       MSYS_NO_CALLBACK, ClickCallback );
04112       if( iButtonID == - 1 )
04113       {
04114             DbgMessage(TOPIC_BUTTON_HANDLER,DBG_LEVEL_0,"CreateCheckBoxButton: Can't create button");
04115             return( -1 );
04116       }
04117 
04118       //change the flags so that it isn't a quick button anymore
04119       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
04120       b->uiFlags &= ( ~BUTTON_QUICK );
04121       b->uiFlags |= ( BUTTON_CHECKBOX | BUTTON_SELFDELETE_IMAGE);
04122 
04123       return( iButtonID );
04124 }

04126 // Added Oct17, 97 Carter - kind of mindless, but might as well have it
04127 void MSYS_SetBtnUserData(INT32 iButtonNum,INT32 index,INT32 userdata)
04128 {
04129   GUI_BUTTON *b;
04130       b=ButtonList[iButtonNum];
04131       if((index < 0) || (index > 3))
04132             return;
04133       if(b != NULL) b->UserData[index]=userdata;
04134 }
04135 
04136 INT32 MSYS_GetBtnUserData(GUI_BUTTON *b,INT32 index)
04137 {
04138       if(index < 0 || index > 3)
04139             return(0);
04140 
04141       return(b->UserData[index]);
04142 }

04144 
04145 //Generic Button Movement Callback to reset the mouse button if the mouse is no longer
04146 //in the button region.
04147 void BtnGenericMouseMoveButtonCallback(GUI_BUTTON *btn,INT32 reason)
04148 {
04149       //If the button isn't the anchored button, then we don't want to modify the button state.
04150       if( btn != gpAnchoredButton )
04151             return;
04152       if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_LOST_MOUSE )
04153       {
04154             if( !gfAnchoredState )
04155             {
04156                   btn->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON );
04157                   if(   btn->ubSoundSchemeID )
04158                   {
04159                         PlayButtonSound( btn->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_OFF );
04160                   }
04161             }
04162 
04163             #ifdef JA2
04164             InvalidateRegion(btn->Area.RegionTopLeftX, btn->Area.RegionTopLeftY, btn->Area.RegionBottomRightX, btn->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
04165             #endif
04166       }
04167       else if( reason & MSYS_CALLBACK_REASON_GAIN_MOUSE )
04168       {
04169             btn->uiFlags |= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON ;
04170             if( btn->ubSoundSchemeID )
04171             {
04172                   PlayButtonSound( btn->IDNum, BUTTON_SOUND_CLICKED_ON );
04173             }
04174 
04175             #ifdef JA2
04176             InvalidateRegion(btn->Area.RegionTopLeftX, btn->Area.RegionTopLeftY, btn->Area.RegionBottomRightX, btn->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
04177             #endif
04178       }
04179 }
04180 
04181 void ReleaseAnchorMode()
04182 {
04183   if( !gpAnchoredButton )
04184             return;
04185 
04186       if(   gusMouseXPos < gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionTopLeftX ||
04187               gusMouseXPos > gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionBottomRightX ||
04188                   gusMouseYPos < gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionTopLeftY ||
04189                   gusMouseYPos > gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionBottomRightY )
04190       {
04191             //released outside button area, so restore previous button state.
04192             if( gfAnchoredState )
04193                   gpAnchoredButton->uiFlags |= BUTTON_CLICKED_ON;
04194             else
04195                   gpAnchoredButton->uiFlags &= ( ~BUTTON_CLICKED_ON );
04196                   #ifdef JA2
04197                   InvalidateRegion(gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionTopLeftX, gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionTopLeftY, gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionBottomRightX, gpAnchoredButton->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
04198                   #endif
04199       }
04200       gpPrevAnchoredButton = gpAnchoredButton;
04201       gpAnchoredButton = NULL;
04202 }
04203 
04204 #ifdef _JA2_RENDER_DIRTY
04205 
04206 
04207 // Used to setup a dirtysaved region for buttons
04208 BOOLEAN     SetButtonSavedRect( INT32 iButton )
04209 {
04210       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04211       INT32 xloc,yloc,w,h;
04212 
04213       Assert( iButton >=0 );
04214       Assert( iButton <MAX_BUTTONS);
04215 
04216       b=ButtonList[ iButton ];
04217 
04218       xloc=b->XLoc;
04219       yloc=b->YLoc;
04220       w = ( b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX );
04221       h = ( b->Area.RegionBottomRightY - b->Area.RegionTopLeftY );
04222 
04223       if ( !(b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND ) )
04224       {
04225             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND;
04226 
04227             b->BackRect = RegisterBackgroundRect(BGND_FLAG_PERMANENT | BGND_FLAG_SAVERECT, NULL,
04228                               (INT16)xloc, (INT16)yloc, (INT16)(xloc+w), (INT16)(yloc+h) );
04229       }
04230 
04231       return( TRUE );
04232 }
04233 
04234 void FreeButtonSavedRect( INT32 iButton )
04235 {
04236       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04237 
04238       Assert( iButton >=0 );
04239       Assert( iButton <MAX_BUTTONS);
04240 
04241       b=ButtonList[ iButton ];
04242 
04243       if ( (b->uiFlags & BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND ) )
04244       {
04245             b->uiFlags &= (~BUTTON_SAVEBACKGROUND);
04246             FreeBackgroundRectPending(b->BackRect);
04247       }
04248 }
04249 
04250 #endif

04252 //Kris:
04253 //Yet new logical additions to the winbart library.
04254 void HideButton( INT32 iButtonNum )
04255 {
04256       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04257 
04258       Assert( iButtonNum >= 0 );
04259       Assert( iButtonNum < MAX_BUTTONS);
04260 
04261       b = ButtonList[ iButtonNum ];
04262 
04263       Assert( b );
04264 
04265       b->Area.uiFlags &= (~MSYS_REGION_ENABLED);
04266       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
04267       #ifdef JA2
04268             InvalidateRegion(b->Area.RegionTopLeftX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
04269       #endif
04270 }
04271 
04272 void ShowButton( INT32 iButtonNum )
04273 {
04274       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04275 
04276       Assert( iButtonNum >= 0 );
04277       Assert( iButtonNum < MAX_BUTTONS);
04278 
04279       b = ButtonList[ iButtonNum ];
04280 
04281       Assert( b );
04282 
04283       b->Area.uiFlags |= MSYS_REGION_ENABLED;
04284       b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;
04285       #ifdef JA2
04286             InvalidateRegion(b->Area.RegionTopLeftX, b->Area.RegionTopLeftY, b->Area.RegionBottomRightX, b->Area.RegionBottomRightY);
04287       #endif
04288 }

04299 
04300 void GiveButtonDefaultStatus( INT32 iButtonID, INT32 iDefaultStatus )
04301 {
04302       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04303       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
04304       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
04305       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
04306       //If new default status added, then this assert may need to be adjusted.
04307       AssertMsg( iDefaultStatus >= DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE && iDefaultStatus <= DEFAULT_STATUS_WINDOWS95,
04308             String( "Illegal button default status of %d", iDefaultStatus ) );
04309       Assert( b );
04310 
04311       if( b->bDefaultStatus != (INT8)iDefaultStatus )
04312       {
04313             b->bDefaultStatus = (INT8)iDefaultStatus;
04314             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;   
04315       }
04316 }
04317 
04318 void RemoveButtonDefaultStatus( INT32 iButtonID )
04319 {
04320       GUI_BUTTON *b;
04321       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
04322       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
04323       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
04324       Assert( b );
04325 
04326       if( b->bDefaultStatus )
04327       {
04328             b->bDefaultStatus = DEFAULT_STATUS_NONE;
04329             b->uiFlags |= BUTTON_DIRTY;   
04330       }
04331 }
04332 
04333 BOOLEAN GetButtonArea(INT32 iButtonID, SGPRect *pRect)
04334 {
04335 GUI_BUTTON *b;
04336 
04337       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
04338       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
04339       Assert(pRect);
04340 
04341       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
04342       Assert( b );
04343 
04344       if((pRect==NULL) || (b==NULL))
04345             return(FALSE);
04346 
04347       pRect->iLeft=b->Area.RegionTopLeftX;
04348       pRect->iTop=b->Area.RegionTopLeftY;
04349       pRect->iRight=b->Area.RegionBottomRightX;
04350       pRect->iBottom=b->Area.RegionBottomRightY;
04351 
04352       return(TRUE);
04353 }
04354 
04355 INT32 GetButtonWidth(INT32 iButtonID)
04356 {
04357 GUI_BUTTON *b;
04358 
04359       Assert( iButtonID >= 0 );
04360       Assert( iButtonID < MAX_BUTTONS);
04361 
04362       b = ButtonList[ iButtonID ];
04363       Assert( b );
04364 
04365       if(b==NULL)
04366             return(-1);
04367 
04368       return(b->Area.RegionBottomRightX - b->Area.RegionTopLeftX);
04369 }
